title: I'm from] Honey Mask 4.23oz | wash off type, real honey 38.7%, Mature skin, Deep moisturization, Nourishment,and Clear Complexion.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
content:
So skin care always works really nice the first couple times I use it, At least for my skin. Remember everyone's skin is different and what works for me might not work for you.

But this product was so moisturizing and gentle on my sensitive skin. It's nice to have the added boost of moisture during the winter months.

One of the things I particularly liked was that I could leave it on my skin for a long period of time without it feeling like the mask was taking moisture from my skin as it dried.

It's made of honey, and smells like it too. But the texture is smooth and not sticky, but do keep in mind that separation can occur during shipment so give the mask a good stir to blend the ingredients all back together before use.

I've only used it once so I can't speak for long term effects, but it was wonderful the first use. But I wouldn't be surprised if the moisturizing benefits are less noticeable once my skin becomes more acclimated to the ingredients.

title: I'm from] Honey Mask 4.23oz | wash off type, real honey 38.7%, Mature skin, Deep moisturization, Nourishment,and Clear Complexion.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
content: Everyone needs to read the fine prints! This product includes 38% real honey as a main ingredient. Since the honey is harvest by the bees, and they eat whatever they want at the mountain, the honey itself can be slightly different by each product. Also due to the temperature, there might be separated layers when you open the product due to the fact that it consists of a high volume of natural honey. It's totally OKAY to use, and you just need to mix it up once. It is super hydrating and a lovely mask for once or twice of week. Makes skin feels super plump and soft. I recommend using a damp microfiber towel or reusable cotton pad to take of the extra face mask to make it a less messy process to wash off in the sink.

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022
content:
I was a little turned off when I opened the package because the lid was stuck and the product had separated quite a bit, but I tried to reserve my judgment and I'm very glad I did. I did lose a little product trying to mix it and clean off the rim of the jar so it wouldn't stick again, but not much.

After a few stirs, it looks like dulce de leche and smells like honey toffee. It's super sticky as to be expected, but creamy too, and applies easily with a silicone spatula (the included plastic spatula would be better for a firmer product, IMO). I only wore it for about ten minutes but my skin felt soft and hydrated after. I tend to steer clear of masks because of the mess factor, and this one definitely isn't tidy, but it smells delicious and makes my skin feel nice, so I'll make an exception for this one.

title: I'm from] Honey Mask 4.23oz | wash off type, real honey 38.7%, Mature skin, Deep moisturization, Nourishment,and Clear Complexion.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2021
content:
Got this on Prime Day, and when it arrived it appeared to be authentic, with seal intact.
- The scent is like raw honey, which I find quite pleasant.
- The mask was initially separated in the jar, and a quick mix restored its creamy consistency that has been maintained.
- I‚Äôve used it about twice a week so far, and that‚Äôs like 8 applications.
- Application: A thin layer on the face and neck, left on for about 40-50 minutes.
- Result: After rinsing off, my skin is softer and calmer. I do need to moisturize afterward or my face feels a bit tight. While I haven‚Äôt noticed a glow or increased hydration, I‚Äôve also not experienced any sensitivity from using this mask, which is great. (My normal skin is quite sensitive and reactive, and I reviewed the ingredient list before buying.)
- Verdict: A decent mask for both pre-party or after-party, to prep the skin or calm it down respectively. I like to use it if my skin is particularly irritated from heat and sweat.

title: [I'm From] Vitamin Tree Water Gel 75g, Vitamin C, B3, Vitamin Water 68%, Niacinamide, Cool sensation, Moistuizing, Organic moisturizer
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019
content:
Since I started using Curology medicated cream, my skin became dry and flaky. The only moisturizer that I used was the Curology moisturizer, but it isn't enough to protect and to moisturize my skin. Also, due to the nature of my sensitive combo skin (dry cheeks and oily everywhere else), it was really hard for me to find a moisturizer that didn't irritate my skin. Then I became desperate and went through my collection of Korean skincare complementary samples, and one of them is the I'm From Vitamin Tree Water-gel, along with a few others, that I really enjoy using on my skin.

For the longest time, I didn't care for moisturizers but after 2 nights of using the gel and gel-cream, my skin looks healthy and youthful again. The gel-cream glides easily on the skin without much force. The consistency is more of a hybrid of gel + cream, meaning that it's lightweight but not watery like other gel moisturizers. It's also not heavy and thick but it can hold the shape very well if you take some with your fingertip. My skin absorbs it easily, and I didn't suffer from any sticky residue. It definitely adds another layer of hydration when I use the Curology medicated cream.

title: [I'm From] Vitamin Tree Water Gel 75g, Vitamin C, B3, Vitamin Water 68%, Niacinamide, Cool sensation, Moistuizing, Organic moisturizer

title: [I'M FROM] Ginseng Serum, 30ml, elasticity, anti-wrinkle, 7.98% ginseng extract
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021
content: So I've been using the ginseng serum twice a day for seven months now, one drop on the forehead and another two on both cheeks. My skin immediately looks more even toned and plumped, and in addition to the temporary immediate effects my forehead and smile lines have also significantly diminished. These lines are more an issue of my face being both expressive and dry/dehydrated, as I've had them since middle school (now mid 20s). And yet, no amount of hydrating serums and layering toners have made my skin look as plumped as this! My routine is simply this serum followed by the Naturie Hatomugi Gel although I've now purchased the eye cream as well during the Cyber Week sale (we'll seehow that works, fingers crossed). highly recommend and my only complaint is the dropper bottle being a bit finicky as I'm just not a fan of those. The scent is also VERY strong but it's pretty deliciously caramel-y and I enjoy it.

title: [I'M FROM] Ginseng Serum, 30ml, elasticity, anti-wrinkle, 7.98% ginseng extract
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2019
content:
I honestly haven't used this long enough to determine if it's beneficial to my skin, but the scent is so bad, and that makes it difficult to use consistently. The scent is strong and unappealingly floral and 'powdery'. It is also possible to detect a slight scent of ginseng, which combines in an offensive way with the powdery, floral scent. I'd heard that it used to just smell like ginseng, and I wish it still did.
It doesn't seem to be a fake product, as I recently read that because it is marketed to older women, it supposedly smells this way (now) to appeal to those consumers. If true, it's a failure of a marketing idea. I guess I would be considered "older", and, based on the scent alone, I will never purchase this product again. I wish I could return it.

title: I'm From Mugwort Essence | 100% Vegan Extract - Soothe Sensitive and Irritated Skin, Redness Relief, Refreshing, Korean Hydrating toner | 5.4 Fl Oz, All Skin Types, PETA approved
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024
content:
I have very sensitive, dehydrated skin and this product is the first thing I reach for when it starts to get red, hot and itchy. It is a no-frills essence that is just 3 ingredients: water, mugwort and a preservative, that‚Äôs it. I think that is why it is something that I can tolerate when my skin is so angry and inflamed. I use it every day now, even when my skin is calm and not irritated.

It is a watery consistency that absorbs very quickly into the skin and feels very cooling and moisturizing on contact. For me, it is a great beginning step right after I cleanse that calms my skin and preps it for my serum and moisturizer. For the days when my skin is extra angry, I will put this on periodically through the day. I almost wish it came in a misting bottle for this purpose!

This bottle will last you quite a while which makes is a great value for your money as well. I have used it at least once (usually two or three times) a day for the last month and I am not even a third of the way through it.

The packaging overall is very nice. I love the weight and feel of the glass bottle (it makes me feel kinda bougie) but just be careful to keep it away from the edge of the sink as it will break if it drops!

Overall, this has become a mainstay in my skincare routine and I would highly recommend it to anyone who has sensitive and/or irritated skin.

content:
If you have ever eaten japanese yomogi mochi/daifuku you are already familiar with this scent, the closest western description I can come up with is an herbal-pine scent. There is no stinging and the skin soaks it up without any lingering tackiness.

I tried the travel/sample size --- love that more affordable option since shops via amazon mostly do not allow returns after trying as far as I know --- and really liked it. I am hoping this will help with my rosacea but haven't used it long enough nor exclusively to really know. That said, I enjoy it enough to continue with a the full sized bottle and give it a try.

I first tried the rice series of this brand for my dry skin and hyperpigmentation issues and like it very much, as well.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
content:
I had high hopes for the Mugwort Essence, but unfortunately, it fell far short of expectations. Firstly, the product is excessively watery, a far cry from the original version. Despite being marketed for sensitive skin, it caused unexpected breakouts and bumps on my face. I diligently followed the usage instructions, but this turned out to be a regrettable purchase.

The moisturizer cream from the same company shares a similar fate‚Äîthin, watery, and messy, offering no justice to my skin. The original, with its thicker texture, was much better. I implore the company to reconsider returning to the thicker essence that truly absorbed into the skin.

This watered-down version not only failed to deliver results but also led to skin issues. If you have sensitive skin, I strongly advise against trusting this product; it's not a wise investment. Returning it was a hassle, and the entire experience was a waste of time and money.

I typically don't write negative reviews, but this product left me profoundly disappointed. As someone who enjoyed great skin previously, I wanted to enhance it further, but this turned out to be a setback. For now, I'm sticking to good old-fashioned cocoa butter for reliable hydration. Save your money and steer clear of this thin, drippy, watery disappointment. üö´ #BuyerBeware #SkinCareDisappointment

content: I used to use the Missha Time Revolution Artemisia Treatment Essence (up to 4 empties), but I stopped using it for a few months to try out different products. I've been going no makeup a lot this summer and noticed that I've been experiencing more redness from the heat and wanted that mugwort goodness, which helps calm and cool my skin a lot. I previously gravitated towards Missha over I'm From because it was a better price point, but I guess since it's undergoing a renewal, I couldn't find it anywhere, so I decided to buy the I'm From essense instead. Using this made me realize how well my skin does with this type of formulation and I shouldn't stray away from a great thing because I was "bored". This essence has a watery consistency, but when it's applied on the face, it has almost a slippery (not slimey) feel to it where it doesn't dissipate as quickly as watery toners. I have oily skin and it doesn't feel too heavy on my skin, it it layers well under makeup, and the redness has definitely subsided a lot since using this. I'll have to keep using it to see if I prefer this or the Missha one more, but at this time, I can't say that I notice a big difference.

content:
If your skin is crying out for a little extra TLC (hello, redness and irritation), I‚Äôm From Mugwort Essence is about to become your new best friend. This little bottle of Korean skincare magic has been a game-changer for my sensitive skin.

The star of the show here is mugwort extract, which is 100% vegan and PETA-approved (love that for us). It‚Äôs incredibly soothing, and after just a few uses, my skin felt less irritated, calmer, and more balanced. If you‚Äôve got redness or sensitivity, this essence works like a gentle hug for your face.

The texture is lightweight, almost watery, so it absorbs quickly without feeling sticky or heavy‚Äîperfect as the first step after cleansing. It leaves my skin feeling refreshed and hydrated, making it an easy addition to any routine, no matter your skin type.

Bonus points for how versatile it is. You can use it to prep your skin before serums, layer it for extra hydration, or even soak a cotton pad and use it like a quick DIY calming mask. It‚Äôs one of those products that makes you feel like you‚Äôve got your skincare life together.

If you‚Äôre looking for a toner that‚Äôs gentle but effective, with clean ingredients and zero fuss, this essence is a must-try. It‚Äôs proof that skincare doesn‚Äôt have to be complicated to make a difference. Calm skin, here we come!

title: [I'M FROM] Mugwort Mask 3.88 fl oz | Natural Herb, Tea tree, Wash-off, Cooling and fast Soothing Breakouts, for Sensitive skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2022
content:
I bought this on a whim as I'm not usually much of a mask person, but I'd heard good things and it's actually really nice.

Mine was missing the spatula, but luckily I had another on hand. The pricetag seemed a little high for an impulse buy, but it only takes about an almond-sized amount to put a thin layer on my whole face, so I imagine it will last a while.

It goes on cool and jelly like and doesn't totally dry down, but does get a little thick so it's slightly difficult to wash off with just hands and water; I'll probably try it before a shower next time. It has a refreshing, distinctly herbal scent and it's instantly soothing on the skin. I didn't even realize my skin felt irritated beforehand, but afterward it felt...less irritated, somehow. It calmed my mild redness and had a very gentle exfoliating effect, leaving my skin feeling extra clean but still hydrated. Plus, it fits my natural bog witch aesthetic.

title: [I'M FROM] Mugwort Mask 3.88 fl oz | Natural Herb, Tea tree, Wash-off, Cooling and fast Soothing Breakouts, for Sensitive skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
content:
This is repeat purchase. I always keep this face mask in the shower and use it 2-3 times per week. It really helps calm the skin and I love that it doesnt irritate my sensitive skin.
I only use it during shower, because the contents are sticky and its extremely hard to get it out of your hair. Using it in the shower eliminates that problem. And no, it doesnt run down on your face until you wash off (the honey mask does so use that one separately) so mugwort one is perfect in shower routine.

title: [I'M FROM] Mugwort Mask 3.88 fl oz | Natural Herb, Tea tree, Wash-off, Cooling and fast Soothing Breakouts, for Sensitive skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
content: Love the soothing effect this mask has on my skin. It is a thicker texture so may a tad bit harder to wash off at the sink, but this exact feature makes it PERFECT to seal the moisture barrier while showering. It needs extra effort to fully wash off so you can stay in shower comfortably, knowing your face is not losing moisture and just wash it off as a final stage. The skin feels hydrated and plump right after! Love the earthy smell, it also has a cooling effect so I imagine it would be very pleasant in summer. It also has a very calming effect on redness and inflamation - 20 minutes on my face is enough to see results. You can pair it with Missha Artemisia Essence for even more mugwort and round it out with a nice occlusive moisturizer. Price seemed a little steep but I will purchase it again.

title: [I'M FROM] Mugwort Mask 3.88 fl oz | Natural Herb, Tea tree, Wash-off, Cooling and fast Soothing Breakouts, for Sensitive skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
content:
I just used this tonight and I got to say this cleared up my blackheads on my nose and made my pores look smaller like nobody's business. Granted, I overhauled my skin care but my blackheads didn't go away until I put this on.

Now with that said, a couple things to note:
The directions say to keep it on 5-10 mins which I think is good. My face was starting to warm up a bit and went a little numb but definitely made me think it was firming me up. On the other hand I gotta be honest, if you can stand to keep this on your face longer than that I have mad respect for you cause THE SMELL IS AWFUL! Like, puke inducing. I was not prepared for that assult on my olfactory sense. My goodness, there was a second where I seriously contemplated snorting perfume to get the smell out of nose. Then I came to my senses and used Vicks around the rim of my nose. It's been about 45 mins and my stomach is still rolling. Which is why I only gave it 4 stars. I mean, why has nobody mentioned this?! It's my 1st experience with mugwort but hot d@mn that is awful. Ugh.

Conclusion: beauty is pain and sometimes you're gonna get assaulted (by terrible smells anyway, not people. Dont assult people. That would be bad). The good outweighs the bad, though. If that changes, I'll update my review (though I'm hoping it wont and maybe I'll get used to the stink...or buy a nose plug like kids at the pool wear.) Hope this helps!

Don't make my mistake, do a patch test

content:

when my skin is irritated and breaking out, it really seems to help cool, calm, and soothe my skin just after using the mask for 15-20mins.
Now the negatives:
It's pricey and somewhat difficult to spread evenly over my face. I've used a spatula, brush and my hands and everytime it is difficult. Also, this mask makes a pretty big mess. It will get stuck in your hairline and will stick to your sink when rinsing.

I think the positive outweighs the negatives, but as usual, ymmv. Overall once I am out of this, I will not repurchase. I will recommend the essence 100x over this mask.

title: [I'M FROM] Mugwort Mask 3.88 fl oz | Natural Herb, Tea tree, Wash-off, Cooling and fast Soothing Breakouts, for Sensitive skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019
content:
I purchased this goop after reading a review from The Strategist, which I usually take with a grain of salt, but this stuff really does have soothing properties. I had an allergic reaction to Farmacy's Green Screen sunscreen which left me with about 30-50 small bumps and whiteheads across my forehead in particular. I was also experiencing redness from the acne/allergic reaction, so I purchased the mugwort hoping it would help. It did!

When the package arrived, there was a small plastic spatula in the box next to the jar of product. There were some green spots on the white applicator and on the interior of the box itself, making me wonder if it had been previously opened. I'm still unsure about that, but I haven't had any problems with the mugwort.

It has a goopy gel base and then basically small twigs and debris thrown in as well. It's not what you would call an Instagram worthy mask, if that's your thing. However, I did feel it soothing my skin as soon as it was applied (to clean, dry skin), and it felt good for the duration (10 minutes) of its application to my face. It was easy to rinse off, and I noticed perhaps a 40% reduction in redness after use.

I used it two days in a row, and it seemed to help clear up some of the disaster left by the Farmacy product. Would recommend if you're just looking for a soothing, moisturizing product.

title: [I'M FROM] Mugwort Mask 3.88 fl oz | Natural Herb, Tea tree, Wash-off, Cooling and fast Soothing Breakouts, for Sensitive skin
date: Reviewed in the Netherlands on November 8, 2022
content:
the product comes with a little spoon, it‚Äôs not a lot of product but you have to spread thin layers across your face, so it will do well. I‚Äôve seen people saying they can‚Äôt the tolerate the smell, but the smell is in my opinion do-able it isn‚Äôt as extreme as people have been saying. it smells very.. tree like? nature like? it says to keep it applied for 5-10 minutes but i like to max that out. after use, my skin feels so SMOOTH! and i also feel like redness has gone down, as i get red quickly. as for acne, it helps my skin but it hasnt been a lifesaver as i‚Äôve used it a few times. i have oily/combo skin and i‚Äôm acne prone. if you don‚Äôt have a routine yet, i would instead go spend money on cleansers, moisturisers etc. and figure out what type skin you have, really saves money if you know.

this mask is nice but it‚Äôs more an extra item for better skin, i have only been using it at the start for every day (bc i wanted fast results) but i‚Äôm lessening that to once or twice a week so it‚Äôs really a routine!

i also wanna give out tips, first it‚Äôs important to go buy sometjing that keeps your hair out of your face when you go to sleep and frequently change your pillow case, as your face can get oily/bacteria from that.

title: I'm from Rice Mask 3.88 Oz, Gentle Exfoliating Wash Off Facial Mask for Dull, Rough Skin, Pore Clearing, Remove Dead Skin Cells, Uneven Skin Tone, Smooth Skin, Moiustirinzg, Radiant
date: Reviewed in Canada on December 6, 2024
content: I believe this is not a facial mask, it would be more appropriate to say it is a scrub. When you apply it on your face, you will see some coarse particles in it. After applying it on your face for 5 minutes, it does not to dry out at all. Instead, you can push out the dead skin by gently rubbing it in circles with your fingers. During the process, the skin feels moisturized, without any artificial fragrance, and has a light rice fragrance. My skin is not oily but a little dry, and I have sensitive skin. After washing the mask, I found that my cheeks were a little allergy, but it disappeared after 10 minutes, so my personal advice is to apply a thin layer first to try it out. I will continue to update after using it next time to see if there are still any allergies.

I have been using this product for over a whole year and it‚Äôs def a staple in my skincare routine. I have tried other Korean products and this is one of those that I‚Äôve had great results with.

I only use 4 products on my skincare after my showers/washes. This is the first one I apply and it‚Äôll remove the extra dirt that the cleanser missed. Sometimes I apply it with my hands as is, other times I use a cotton pad and wipe my face. Then, I apply rose water spray + hyaluronic acid on top and everything mixes well together. I‚Äôve never experienced an allergic or skin reaction to mixing it with other skincare products.

I have noticed that whenever I stop using this product, I do break out more often. I think the big bottle is worth the value for the money but the travel size one is way too small.

Overall, I am a happy customer and will continue using! A bottle typically lasts me 1-2 months and I use it 2x per day every day!

I started using this after seeing it on TikTok and liking the reviews and results people were sharing.
It was the first Korean skincare that I started with and I absolutely loved it!

It‚Äôs milky and watery and I used it like recommended on the hands then rubbing it gently on my face and neck instead of putting on a cotton pad and waisting the product.

It gives a healthy glow and hydration! It felt nice on my skin from the first use and I have dry skin especially during winter, I get a lot of dry skin flares around my mouth area. It helped with the flares and kept my skin hydrated.

I alternate my skincare routine on a daily basis, I don‚Äôt use the same steps AM & PM every single day.
I sometimes use it PM and not AM and other times the other way around. I see what my skin needs and I do it. If I want an extra boost of hydration I apply it after cleansing on clean dry skin.

I have oily combination skin and had to issues with this toner. I absolutely recommend it! I finished 2 bottles of it and will definitely get more.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
content:
The Mugwort Moisturizer, like its counterpart, left me utterly disappointed. Its thin and watery consistency not only failed to live up to the original but also caused unexpected breakouts and bumps on my supposedly sensitive skin.

Much like the Mugwort Essence, the moisturizer's poor quality became evident‚Äîdripping and lacking the effectiveness of its thicker predecessor. The thin, watery formula does no justice to the skin, leaving me wishing for the return of the original's superior texture.

Regrettably, this product doesn't hold up to its promises, and if you have sensitive skin, consider this a cautionary tale. The return process was a hassle, and the entire experience felt like a waste of time and money.

While negative reviews aren't my usual approach, this product left me with no choice. For reliable hydration, I'll be sticking to tried-and-true solutions like good old-fashioned cocoa butter. content:
I use this cream almost every day and sometimes even twice. It tends to work best in my nighttime routine towards the end of it when I'm layering moisturizers (in my mid 50s so I'm hitting my skin hard to keep it hydrated and supple). This cream is one of the last things to go on my skin before the occlusive moisturizer. What do I love about it? It's calming and soothing as I apply it. I keep it in my skincare frig so it feels even BETTER when going on nice and cold. Especially for summer. Mugwort is a K-beauty staple renowned for its soothing properties and I've noticed it seems to help with my rosacea-prone skin. Also, the scent of this cream is deeply earthy and extremely calming to me. I'm keeping this in the rotation even through winter. As a lighter-textured cream, this works best in a layering routine for people with mature or dry skin. Oily skin would probably do well with this as a stand alone.

Love it! Might try their licorice cream next.

title: I'm from] Fig Cleansing balm 100ml, korean makeup remover, vegan, Easy to rinse off, Fig oil water 7.8% with Peptide and Amino Acid, Makeup Meltaway, makeup melting balm to oil
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
content: I was using a mandarin orange cleansing balm before deciding to try this one out. The use of fig intrigued me and I was really excited to try it. I have previously had really awful acne after having kids and doc kept saying it'll go away after my hormones regulate but it never did. Got a facial and esthetician recommended trying products to add moisture instead of the drying acne products I was using. I did a bunch of research and bought my first cleansing balm to pair with a gel cleanser and a few other products. Within two months my skin was clear, not perfect but finally clear. I used this product after running out of my second refill of the other cleanser and I was immediately kind of disappointed. The smell is nice but is quite strong and lingers on the face even after a second wash, essence, toner, and moisturizer. The product also did not melt very well. There was a rather hard layer on top which transitioned into a soft creamy texture closer to the bottom of the container rather than a uniform consistency that melts. I was left with very stubborn chunks that required a lot of pressure and friction to break down. Not exactly ideal. Ended up just digging under the weird top layer to get to the softer area. I did use the entire container but my skin has started breaking out again and I didn't feel as clean as I did after using the mandarin orange balm I had been using before. I've gone back to the orange and my skin is already starting to feel better. If you have acne prone skin maybe try something else first.

title: I'm from] Fig Cleansing balm 100ml, korean makeup remover, vegan, Easy to rinse off, Fig oil water 7.8% with Peptide and Amino Acid, Makeup Meltaway, makeup melting balm to oil
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
content:
First of all, if you love the scent of figs, you will love the smell of this stuff. It reminds me of a body mist I used to have from Henri Bendel (RIP). Beyond that the balm performs very efficiently to my surprise. I'm used to using oil formula makeup removers in my double cleansing but this is a great alternative.

I'm also glad that the ingredients have nothing I hate, like dimethicone or acrylates. I just wish the ingredients were a bit more natural, at least the wax. Still, it's a great find. I definitely want to try more from this brand.

title: I'm from] Fig Cleansing balm 100ml, korean makeup remover, vegan, Easy to rinse off, Fig oil water 7.8% with Peptide and Amino Acid, Makeup Meltaway, makeup melting balm to oil
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
content:
[I'M FROM] Fig Cleansing Balm 100ml

I LOVE THIS. It only takes a small amount to clean off all of your makeup, including mascara. It comes with a small plastic scoop and I found that 1/2 the scoop will clean my entire face. I gently massage into to my skin and then rinse with warm water. Everything just melts off. I follow that up with a microfiber towel to remove any stubborn makeup like waterproof mascara. If I am not wearing any makeup, I let the residue remain after a quick rinse. The texture is very appealing. It is somewhere between a gel and a cream. It glides on like magic. It does have a light fragrance but nothing that irritates my sensitive, dry skin.

Ingredients
Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Polyethylene, Synthetic Wax, Ficus Carica (Fig) Fruit Extract, PEG-10 Isostearate, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Fragrance, Sorbitan Sesquioleate, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Moringa Oleifera Seed Oil, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Melia Azadirachta Flower Extract, Melia Azadirachta Leaf Extract, Melia Azadirachta Bark Extract, Corallina Officinalis Extract, Ocimum Sanctum Leaf Extract

Key Ingredients
Antioxidant: Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract
Skin brightening: Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract
Soothing: Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract

Abrasive/scrub: Synthetic Wax
Antimicrobial/antibacterial: Melia Azadirachta Bark Extract
Emollient: Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Synthetic Wax, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Caprylyl Glycol, Moringa Oleifera Seed Oil
Emulsifying: PEG-10 Isostearate, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Sorbitan Sesquioleate
Moisturizer/humectant: Ficus Carica (Fig) Fruit Extract, Caprylyl Glycol
Perfuming: Fragrance, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract
Preservative: Ethylhexylglycerin
Surfactant/cleansing: PEG-10 Isostearate
Viscosity controlling: Polyethylene, Synthetic Wax

title: I'm from] Fig Cleansing balm 100ml, korean makeup remover, vegan, Easy to rinse off, Fig oil water 7.8% with Peptide and Amino Acid, Makeup Meltaway, makeup melting balm to oil
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
content:
I'm very loyal to cleansing balms for my first cleanse. My two favorites are both OG K-Beauty Holy Grail products - BanilaCo Clean It Zero and Heimish All Clean. Both go on thick and a bit greasy, handily dissolve even the toughest waterproof eye makeup, emulsify easily and rinse clean. Honestly, I didn't think there would ever be another brand that could challenge my love for these two.

But this I'm from Fig Cleansing Balm is...well, the BOMB. It does everything that BanilaCo and Heimish do, plus it has the amazing [but mild] fragrance of figs. I love using this stuff. It feels so luxurious, yet is so lightweight. It has a load of natural plant extracts, including fig (naturally), moringa seed oil and turmeric. Of course, if you're avoiding artificial fragrance in your skincare, I'm obligated to mention there's that as well.

title: I'm from] Fig Cleansing balm 100ml, korean makeup remover, vegan, Easy to rinse off, Fig oil water 7.8% with Peptide and Amino Acid, Makeup Meltaway, makeup melting balm to oil

The density separates it from the pack and the scent makes it memorable. I try a lot of skin creams....this one I will buy.

title: [I'M FROM] Fig Scrub Mask 120g, exfoliating, moisturizing mask, korean exfoliator, organic skin care

content:
This is a really effective mask to scrub product. It has a mild earthy, fig like scent. You leave it on for 15 minutes and then wash it off. My face really reddened afterwards which was mostly gone in the morning.

The change to the texture of my skin was pretty dramatic. My skin was so smooth afterwards, even areas with uneven texture that had resisted other masks. It felt a little like I was sand blasted. My skin is a bit too fragile to use this very often but as a once in a while tune up? It really works.

Plan on showering it off....I spent a whole lot of time at the sink trying to rinse it off and it‚Äôs still in my hair line.

title: [I'm From] Miniatures of Rice Toner, Mugwort Essence, Fig Boosting Essence (Rice), Travel Essentials, Stocking Stuffers, Gifts for Women
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
content:
I was preface by saying this is a phenomenonal toner! It's moisturizing and cleansing! It does smell a bit odd, but nothing super off-putting.

However, I purchased this on the preface of it being safe for a damaged barrier and I found this was not entirely true. It burned a little bit on contact with my skin, which I should've known would happen since this does contain Actives. It definitely is pricey, and I've found replacing the cap and plug with a spray cap (I just took a 1 fl oz travel spray bottle and replaced the cap on the original bottle) makes it last WORLDS longer!
All in all it's a great toner if barrier repair isn't a concern for you!

title: [I'm from] Vitamin Fruit Serum 1.01 Fl Oz | 74% Sea Buckthorn with 1032mg vitamin C, Glow, Smooth, Soft Skin, Light Texture, Korean vitamin c serum
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2021
content:
The I'm Drom Vitamin Fruit Serum comes suitably packaged in a clear, glass and plastic 1oz pump and retails for $27 as of this writing. Korean-made brand. Nourishing. Works well on combination, sensitive skin without causing flares, breakouts, or excessive dryness or oiliness. The serum itself is cloudy and off-yellow, lightweight, with good spreadability, and melts into skin without leaving a sticky or heavy residue. I appreciate they formulated this with the highlighted ingredient as the first on the list (74% sea buckthorn extract) in lieu of water. Seemingly effective at keeping my skin balanced and boosts hydration when paired with a good (not expensive) moisturizer.

This serum met my expectations and I liked the quality and use.

title: [I'm from] Vitamin Fruit Serum 1.01 Fl Oz | 74% Sea Buckthorn with 1032mg vitamin C, Glow, Smooth, Soft Skin, Light Texture, Korean vitamin c serum
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021
content:
This [I'm from] Vitamin Fruit serum comes in a transparent, colorless bottle and the serum is a light yellow color. It has a liquid but slightly viscous gel texture. It absorbs quickly and doesn't leave a sticky residue. The pump dispenser works well and comes with a cap for hygiene.

It's fragrance free and essential oil free. The first ingredient is Vitamin Fruit extract (aka Hippophae Rhamnoides or seaberry extract), which has antioxidant and soothing effects. It also contains hyaluronic acid for moisture retention and both niacinamide and ascorbic acid (Vitamin C) for brightening. However, it's mostly the niacinamide doing the work there since ascorbic acid will degrade quickly from light exposure in a transparent bottle, and is also much lower down in the ingredient list.

It's made in Korea. The box has a sticker seal, and both the bottom of the bottle and the outer box are clearly marked with the expiration date, and the full ingredients are printed in both English and Korean on the box, but not the bottle.
The ingredients are:
Hippophae Rhamnoides Fruit Extract, Methylpropanediol, 1, 2-Hexandiol, Glycerin, Niacinamide, Cyclohexasiloxane, Portulaca Oleracea Extract, Malpighia Glabra (Acerola) Fruit Extract, Laminaria Japonica Extract, Eclipta Prostrata Leaf Extract, Acmella Oleracea Extract, Azadirachta Leaf Extract, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Ocimum Sanctum Leaf Extract, Corallina Officinalis Extract, Hippophae Rhamnoides Oil, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Xantan Gum, Tocopheryl Acetate, Adenosine, Carbomer, Fructooligosaccharides, Disodium EDTA, Beta-Glucan, Tromethamine, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Water, Ascorbic Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin

title: [I'm from] Miniature Set, Rice Toner, Mugwort Essence, Honey mask, Gifts for Women, Travel Essentials, Stocking Stuffers
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
content: I got this half price ($18) because the internet has been raving about these products for years. Each of them is $20-35 full size, so I thought this would be a nice way to try them. To begin with, the I'm From Honey mask arrives half-full, so just we aware of that. I apply about one fingertip length's worth to my face before I shower, hoping that it will lock in some hydration. Typically my face gets tight after showering just from me splashing water over it - as the water evaporates, my face feels dry. This mask didn't help. I've used it 4 times, and it just doesn't add any noticeable hydration for me. The two toners are sort of a similar story...they're not bad, but I wouldn't run out to buy them. Almost every other toner I've tried I like as much or more. I just feel lie overall I'm From products are not worth their high price tags relative to other Asian Beauty products. I'm glad I tried this before buying full size versions,

title: [I'm from] Miniature Set, Rice Toner, Mugwort Essence, Honey mask, Gifts for Women, Travel Essentials, Stocking Stuffers
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2022
content:
I like testing products out before buying a bigger version so I love these little sets - they really are perfect for travel as well! Each of these products offer something different but help overall with my needs. I have dry skin with redness on my cheeks and occasional breakouts on my forehead from an autoimmune disease so my "normal" skin has phases of sensitivity and redness when touched depending on the time of year. These products are awesome.

The honey mask isn't one I use every day - more like once a week when I have time because I have other soothing options so if this all you have you could do it 3 times a week - not sure if I'd do it every day tbh. Honey is great for dry skin and irritated skin so I fit both - you paint this on with a plastic applicator, wait a bit and gently remove it (I use the makeup eraser instead of a washcloth so its not abrasive).

The MUGWORT Essence - I can't brag on this enough if you are inflamed - if I had a day where my cheeks hate me for whatever reason (finicky rosacea is finicky) this is my go to right after washing my face. or removing the honey mask. I'll admit on one particularly BAD day it didn't feel as soothing as the creams that followed but it did help the redness go down so it was worth it. Best ever - I apply it almost every day.

The RICE TONER - okay so I have a hit and miss with this (but it's not its fault) my auto-immune disease means I can't have much rice in my diet and I figure absorbing it into my skin is just as bad. So this toner I don't use every day - but if that weren't the case I would because it is AMAZING and so SOOTHING. Highly recommend as a main toner for those without hashimotos

5 stars easily earned - sometimes it's so popular the small kit is sold out and unavailable - the bigger versions are WORTH it - I have those too. If you can get this it is great as a present too.

title: I‚Äôm from Beet Refresh Pad 60 sheets, triple-layered pads hold 260ml essence, 20% red beet extract from Korea, Full of moisture with a slice of Red Beet, vitality for dull, rough skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2022
content:
This review is for I‚Äôm From Beet Refresh Pad 60 sheets, triple-layered pads hold 260ml essence, 20% red beet extract from Korea, Full of moisture with a slice of Red Beet, vitality for dull, rough skin

I have been wanting to try out something from this brand, "I'm From" for a while. The product was in a pretty large box and the container is larger than I had expected. With that said I think the container might be too large? Reason I say this is because the pads are a mess in there and slid all over the place. Thankfully there's some mini tongs that could be used to grab the individual pads. Another good point is that there was a freshness seal on the container so nothing could leak out.

I use this as a toner/essence. The material of the pad feels very soft and plush, kind of like thin fabric. The essence viscosity is typical of toners and essences. Can use this as a spot treatment mask for different parts of the face rather than as a toner type. There's a lot of liquid in the jar though, so the pads come soaked.

It seems gentle and moisturizing and hasn't irritated the skin. It doesn't have any added fragrances and/or oils which is a plus so I'm not sure where the scent for the product comes from. It is a light pleasant scent though.

title: I‚Äôm from Beet Refresh Pad 60 sheets, triple-layered pads hold 260ml essence, 20% red beet extract from Korea, Full of moisture with a slice of Red Beet, vitality for dull, rough skin

title: I‚Äôm from Beet Refresh Pad 60 sheets, triple-layered pads hold 260ml essence, 20% red beet extract from Korea, Full of moisture with a slice of Red Beet, vitality for dull, rough skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
content:
This is a pretty good essence. I like the essence itself. The pads are heavily saturated in the essence. The box and packaging say there is 60 pads included and there is extra essence in the container to keep the pads well saturated. When I opened the container the pads were all tossed about the containers instead of nice neat and stacked like other products I have received like this.

I was nervous that this product would make my face a little red or pink due to the use of beets in this product and because the instructions also say to rinse your face after use and then pat remaining essence onto your skin. There is no need to worry about this essence making your face red or pink. The only thing I saw and felt after use of this essence was that my skin had a dewy glow to it. I did not rinse my face after use or remove the product. I just let it absorb which didn't take more than a couple minutes. The one thing that was disappointing about this essence is that the pad just completely shreds and falls apart during application. One of my favorite things about this essence pad is that it fits my foreo ufo 2 device. I love products that pair well with not only my skin care routines but also my skin care devices.

Overall I really like this essence pad. I love that it comes with tweezers to help keep your other pads clean and free of contamination. I really like the look and feel that this essence gives my skin. I see a nice bright dewy glow when I use this product. It doesn‚Äôt leave my skin sticky or tacky at all and it fully absorbs in matter of minutes. And I LOVE that this works with my foreo ufo 2 device, just keep in mind the pads do shred very easily. This essence has really good ingredients and I‚Äôll probably end up using this maybe once or twice a week to help clean and brighten my skin tone. I would definitely recommend this essence pad to help brighten, exfoliate and prevent signs of aging. Very pleasantly happy with this item.

title: I‚Äôm from Beet Refresh Pad 60 sheets, triple-layered pads hold 260ml essence, 20% red beet extract from Korea, Full of moisture with a slice of Red Beet, vitality for dull, rough skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
content:
I was a bit skeptical about using a skincare product that contains beet extract, but these refreshing pads have made me a believer! The pads are triple-layered and hold a whopping 260ml of essence, which is enough to cover my face and neck twice. I noticed that my skin felt moisturized and looked glowing after using them.

What impressed me the most was that these pads also helped calm down my redness. I have some areas of my face that tend to get irritated and turn red easily, but the beet extract in these pads seemed to have a calming effect on my skin. Overall, I'm really happy with my purchase and would definitely recommend these to anyone looking for a hydrating and soothing skincare product.

title: I‚Äôm from Beet Refresh Pad 60 sheets, triple-layered pads hold 260ml essence, 20% red beet extract from Korea, Full of moisture with a slice of Red Beet, vitality for dull, rough skin

content:
These beet pads are like mini masks for your skin. After cleansing, you place the circles on your skin wherever you need some extra hydration, or to calm redness. You let it sit for a little while, just like a sheet mask, then you can wipe any remaining product from the pads over your face before discarding. No need to rinse your face after, just let the product soak in.

This stuff is pretty good and really does leave my skin feeling fresh and hydrated. I like to use a thicker moisturizer after to really lock in the hydration. My skin is mildly sensitive and didn't have any negative reaction to these and did genuinely seem calmed. If you're looking to add a regular mask regimen to your skin care routine, this is a great way to do it!

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
content:
I'd used this regularly while dealing with regular acne breakouts, then took a break from everything except bare basics to repair my skin barrier. The majority of my acne cleared up during this time.

The first day I incorporated this ampoule back into my routine, I got 3 new pimples outside of my regular problem areas, so now I know that unfortunately this product is one of my acne culprits. I'm thinking my skin reacted poorly to it because of beets' high vitamin C content, which is a common irritant for people with skin sensitivity.

TL;DR avoid this product if your skin is sensitive to vitamin C, otherwise it may be worth trying.

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2022
content: First of all, the packaging is very cute, and the bottle looks adorable on my shelf. The ampoule dropper bottle style is easy to use and allows for repeated use without worrying about contamination. The texture of the serum is smooth and feels nice at first, but it felt like it burned my skin a little bit. I have very sensitive and acne prone skin, so it is completely possible this wouldn't be a problem for other users who need moisture in their daily skincare routine. I did not see a noticeable difference in my skin after using this. I mostly just use it on the backs of my hands now.

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
content: I've used several different products from the I'm From Korean-Made brand. I enjoyed their Rice and Mugwort lines so much that I decided to give other products a go, like this Beet Energy Ampoule. Ampoules are concentrated serums, so I'll reference the term serum for the rest of the review. To use: cleanse and tone, though toning is not a requirement, and while the skin is still moist, take a few drops of this cloudy, otherwise colorless runny gel and massage or pat it over the face and neck. Follow with your favorite moisturizer (SPF in the AM). This serum comes in a pretty pink 1oz glass dropper for ~$24 as of this review. Affordable. Suitable for use on sensitive skin. Hasn't caused any breakouts or flares. Non-drying, non-irritating. Not greasy, smelly, sticky, or unpleasant to use.

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2022
content: Living in the desert can really make your skin super dry. I decided to give this product a try and see if can notice a difference. I was pleasantly surprised by how soft it left my skin after the first use. It does have a bit of a watery consistency and can be a bit tacky at first, but after a while it makes your skin so soft. After a few days of using this, I have noticed a difference.

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2022
content: This serum wasn't bad, per sea, but it's just not a win for me. It was fairly neutral in feeling overall, with the exception of a strange stickiness that persisted quite a while after application. The results were fairly minimal, on par with any other basic moisturizing serum. The scent is almost non-existent. Overall, I don't feel that the results were worth the odd sticky feeling.

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
content: I am very chemical-sensitive so was disappointed. I bought it for the "organic" beet extract and the potential benefits from natural ingredients, but a few of the ingredients, although they might be approved by the FDA, are not acceptable to me, and may be carcinogenic as well as have other long-term side effects. They are synthetic including tromethamine, as well as acrylates/C10-30 - unnatural acrylate copolymers are microplastic chemicals. Anything you put on the skin can permeate into deeper tissues and into your blood stream and body faster than ingesting it, plus chemicals put on the face being so close to the eyes, nose, and mouth can often accidentally. get into those parts of the body. I won't be using it.

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2022
content:
I've used several I'm From products over the years and have had good experiences with them, but this is the first time I've tried one of their ampoules.

First off I have combination, hormonal acne-prone skin. I really like the packaging and look and feel of this bottle. I generally use this day and night and apply a couple drops to my face and my neck. The ampoule is fragrance-free and absorbs after a few minutes. My face feels sticky after application, but feels soft and smooth after the product fully absorbs. Overall, I feel that the ampoule moisturizes, brightens, and slightly energizes my skin.

I'd recommend this to anyone who's looking to rejuvenate and brighten their skin.

title: I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2022
content:
This review is for I'm from Beet Energy Ampoule, 81.5% red beet extract, Intensive vitalization care, Micro Squalane Capsules for deeper hydration, rich in minerals and betaine, radiance, nourishment - 30ml

This product comes in a glass bottle with a dropper. It has great ingredients and seems to have no added fragrances, essential oils, or alcohols. I really enjoy these types of products and I especially have been having good results with these products from the "I'm from" brand. I use this ampoule after cleansing and a toner, and I always follow up with moisturizer. This product doesn't feel heavy or greasy and leaves no residue. It absorbs quite fast and leaves skin feeling moisturized. I haven't had any bad reaction from this product and am enjoying it so far. You don't need much for your entire face!

Ingredients: Beta Vulgaris (Beet) Root Extract, Glycerin, Squalane, Propanediol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Niacinamide, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Tromethamine, Xanthan Gum, Panthenol, Adenosine, Allantoin, Carnosine

content: The [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen has good UVA/B (SPF50 US, PA++++ Japan rating) coverage. A lightweight, white cream with a slight fragrance - not overpowering or unpleasant. It does leave a hint of a white cast common with mineral blockers (zinc oxide), but it disappears within minutes of wear. Suitable packaging. No irritation, breakouts, or flares.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
content: I suffer from melasma and while trying to protect skin from further pigmentation, you have to be careful what kind of sunscreen you get. Chemical sunscreens can exacerbate melasma! It's hard to find a good mineral sunscreen that has a nice finish, but this one checks the boxes for me! It's a true mineral sunscreen. Doesn't feel sticky, heavy, or greasy and doesn't give me white cast. I really love the whole I'm From Rice line and this is a great addition.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2022
content: This is a pretty thick sunscreen, but it blends in with your skin tone well. Not oily or greasy, protects as promised. Not my favorite Korean sunscreen, but pretty good.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2022
content: A little goes a long way. This sunblock is thicker than I expected, so I like to use it under my make up. It has a blue tint on me, and work well with my foundation. Although its thick, it‚Äôs not heavy. The scent is neither pleasing or offensive.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2022
content: Great sun protection, nice packaging, no skin irritation.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
content:
This isn't like any sunscreen I've used before. It dries down completely matte although it does take some time to blend in. It's definitely not for everyone because it does leave a bit of a white cast on the skin which I assume is the "brightening" effect of rice in the sunscreen.
Those who are sensitive may not enjoy the light floral fragrance in the sunscreen but I didn't note any breakouts or irritation while using it myself.
It's a little on the thicker side and mixed well with water based foundation. It didn't pill up on the skin but do make sure to not use this with a serum or any silicone based products to avoid that.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2022
content:
Overall very nice and natural sunscreen made from rice. It is slightly more greasy for me, at least in the beginning but becomes dry and invisible rapidly.
Like the fact that it has been tested on humans and is safe.
Love natural products.
Recommended

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
content: A very nice Korean sunscreen. This has no scent/fragrance, which I really like. There is no white cast when going on. It is very lightweight on the skin, I felt like I had nothing on, yet my skin was protected from the sun! Highly recommend!

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2022
content:
This sunscreen passes my two major tests for sunscreens:

1. Doesn't contain cancer causing (as of this writing) chemicals.
2. Doesn't make me look like a ghost. My skin usually doesn't absorb physical sunscreen very well and my skin looks really white.

It doesn't smell too much, which is also a plus. It is a small amount compared to the giant tubes of Costco sized sunscreen, so keep that in mind.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
content: I am totally in love with this zinc oxide sunscreen. It is very light, and does not feel greasy or heavy like some other sunscreen. I knew that I could always trust a Korean sunscreen, and true to its reputation, this rice sunscreen protects the skin from UVA/UVB without being too oily or too drying. With 40% rice extract, it is also beneficial to the skin as rice extract can reduce UV damage, wrinkle, hyperpigmentation, dead skin cells, and increase skin ceramide production. It is also reef safe and easily absorbs into the skin without leaving any white cast.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
content: I like skin product with minimal decorations or colors. Just simple and true to the content. SPF 50+ is a pleasant surprise, with how light the cream feels I'm convinced it's more like in the SPF 30+ range. The best part is the light-weighted feeling after applying so it doesn't cause burdens to the skin. It's easy to absorb on the skin and smooth to spread out when applying.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2022
content:
I actually like how this feels on my overly sensitive skin, and there are a lot of great cosmetics coming out of Korea. So, as long as you know this is not something that went through any US cosmetic approval and doesn't even have the normal FDA sunscreen ingredient list you may find it a little charming. I have no idea what percentage of Zinc is in here, and should you really trust the SPF 50 if they weren't tested by the FDA? Personally I would feel better it is doing what it says if they went through the approval.

However, I hate chemical sunscreens (avobenzone, octinoxate, oxybenzone etc.) and this is clearly using zinc, the 41% rice extract feels great, a lot like glycerine, it rubs in clear and does not leave white residue if you put it on first on a clean face. I have not noticed any irritation or breakouts after using it daily. Overall I am glad I tried it but you can get something from a trusted brand for about the same price, double the quantity, and with an actual drug label that offers consumers some protection.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2022
content: I really like this brand. This sunscreen is 50+ spf. It has a very light and pleasant aroma. It spreads evenly and doesn't feel thick or heavy. It absorbs well but leaves a slight white cast that fades over time. It is free of chemical sunscreens that some people are sensitive to, and it is reef safe. The box has the ingredients listed in English on the side. It is 41% rice extract and contains zinc oxide. The item I received was stamped with an expiration date in 2025. Nice and fresh! I enjoyed trying this sunscreen and was very pleased with it's performance.

title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection

I‚Äôm grateful that the container inside the box wasn‚Äôt popped open because this box was FLATTENED. Of course the price for this jumped up too, but so did everything else to be fair. title: [I'm from] Rice Sunscreen 50ml, Physical, rice extract 41%, Non-nano zinc oxide, Reef friendly, skin sun protection

it also DOESN'T BURN YOUR EYES! This is a huge plus for me because everyday sunblock gets into my eyes and leaves them burning and red. This doesn't do that!
Very happy with this sunscreen!

The first thing I noticed about this cream was that it's completely unscented. It's thick, hydrating, and non irritating. I always get nervous when trying a heavier moisturizer like this one but after sleeping with it on overnight and waking up to the softest most plump skin I was in love. I really appreciate having a jar instead of a pump so you can use every last drop of it without being wasteful.
The packaging feels luxurious but without frills or looking overdone. I'd recommend this for dry, sensitive, and dehydrated skin. Even aging skin could really see benefit from using this continually.

title: I‚Äôm from Mushroom Collagen Cream 1.69 Fl Oz, Vegan, Collagens, Skin Firming Cream for Face, Anti Wrinkles, All Natural Organic Face Moisturizer
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
content: I'm pleasantly surprised by how awesome this cream is. It is not my typical cream that I expect, which is very thick. This one is very rich and creamy, but doesn't feel heavy on face. However, it still lasts through the night. My face feels so smooth and soft the next morning. I do think you can use it as a day cream as well since it doesn't really feel oily (even though a bit richer than regular moisturizer, it is really hydrating and locks the moist). It has no fragrance which is a plus for me (less artificial chemicals). I have dry and hypersensitive skin. I have had no bad reaction to this cream after a week use. This brand is supposed to be all natural ingredients. All the info on the jar is in Korean, so you may need google translator if you do not read Korean. I'm totally in love with this cream.

title: I‚Äôm from Mushroom Collagen Cream 1.69 Fl Oz, Vegan, Collagens, Skin Firming Cream for Face, Anti Wrinkles, All Natural Organic Face Moisturizer

content: Its really assuring to see the rise of vegan skin care products as we explore the alternatives and benefits of these ingredients. The mushroom collagen was surprisingly comfortable to use and rather long lasting for night time routines. I was able to put on a thin layer at the end of my skin care routine at night and wake up to a sufficiently moisturized and plumped face. The collagen seems to tackle the wrinkle problem just fine without noticeable difference from the traditional form.

title: I‚Äôm from Mushroom Collagen Cream 1.69 Fl Oz, Vegan, Collagens, Skin Firming Cream for Face, Anti Wrinkles, All Natural Organic Face Moisturizer

And I love that the collagen is derived from a plant instead of an animal source. One application in the morning is all I need to keep going all day. It really works fantastically, I highly recommend. Expiration on my jar is October 2025.

title: I‚Äôm from Mushroom Collagen Cream 1.69 Fl Oz, Vegan, Collagens, Skin Firming Cream for Face, Anti Wrinkles, All Natural Organic Face Moisturizer
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2022
content:
I recently tried this moisturizer that contains mushroom extract and collagen, and I was impressed by the results. The moisturizer had a thick, creamy texture and applied and absorbed easily into my skin.

One of the standout features advertised by this product was its ability to improve the firmness and elasticity of my skin. After using it for a few days, I actually noticed that my skin felt more supple and smoothed some of my texture. The mushroom extract and collagen seemed to work together to nourish and revitalize my skin.

In terms of overall performance, I was pretty happy with this moisturizer. It left my skin feeling hydrated and smooth, and the added benefits of the mushroom extract and collagen were not something I would‚Äôve even considered. If you're looking for a moisturizer that will help improve the firmness and elasticity of your skin, I would definitely recommend giving this one a try.

title: I‚Äôm from Mushroom Collagen Cream 1.69 Fl Oz, Vegan, Collagens, Skin Firming Cream for Face, Anti Wrinkles, All Natural Organic Face Moisturizer
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022
content:
[I‚Äôm from] Mushroom Collagen Cream

The key ingredient in this cream is Tremella Fuciformis Extract which is a polysaccharide (a big sugar molecule) coming from the edible fruit bodies of the Silver Ear mushroom in China. It's claimed to be an awesome moisturizer with slightly greater water-holding capacities than Hylauronic Acid. I found that this is very true. I have super dry skin that is also sensitive and this worked wonders on my winter dry skin. It felts a bit like snail mucin at first since it is a bit sticky but there is no snail mucin in this. It left my skin with a good protective barrier. This is the second cream I have tried from this brand and have loved both.

This comes in a pretty mushroom-colored glass jar and the package is safety-sealed. It is made in Korea and expires in 10.25 but should be used within 12 months of opening.

#alcohol-free #fragrance & essential oil-free
Key Ingredients
Anti-acne: Niacinamide
Cell-communicating ingredients: Niacinamide, Adenosine
Skin brightening: Niacinamide
Skin-identical ingredient: Glycerin, Ceramide NP
Soothing: Beta-Glucan, Sucrose

ALL INGREDIENTS BY FUNCTION
Antioxidant: Hydroxyacetophenone
Emollient: Hydrogenated Poly(C6-14 Olefin), Pentaerythrityl Tetraethylhexanoate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Diisostearyl Malate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Behenyl Alcohol
Emulsifying: Polyglyceryl-3 Methylglucose Distearate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Cetearyl Olivate, Sorbitan Olivate, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Sorbitan Isostearate
Moisturizer/humectant: Tremella Fuciformis (Mushroom) Extract (30%), Glycerin, Niacinamide, Soluble Collagen, Butylene Glycol, Hydrolyzed Corn Starch, Beta-Glucan, Sucrose, Mannose, Glucose
Preservative: Ethylhexylglycerin
Solvent: Water, Methyl Trimethicone, Butylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol
Surfactant/cleansing: Diisostearyl Malate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate
Viscosity controlling: Hydrogenated Poly(C6-14 Olefin), Pentaerythrityl Tetraethylhexanoate, Vinyl Dimethicone, Cetearyl Alcohol, Behenyl Alcohol, Phytosteryl/Isostearyl/Cetyl/Stearyl/Behenyl Dimer Dilinoleate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Xanthan Gum, Hydrolyzed Corn Starch

Ingredients
Water, Tremella Fuciformis (Mushroom) Extract (30%), Glycerin, Hydrogenated Poly(C6-14 Olefin), Pentaerythrityl Tetraethylhexanoate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Polyglyceryl-3 Methylglucose Distearate, Niacinamide, Vinyl Dimethicone, Diisostearyl Malate, Methyl Trimethicone, Cetearyl Alcohol, Behenyl Alcohol, Cetearyl Olivate, Sorbitan Olivate, Phytosteryl/Isostearyl/Cetyl/Stearyl/Behenyl Dimer Dilinoleate, Dioscorea Japonica Root Extract, Soluble Collagen, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/Vp Copolymer, Butylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Adenosine, Sorbitan Isostearate, Hydrolyzed Corn Starch, Beta-Glucan, Sucrose, Ceramide Np, Mannose, Glucose, 1,2-Hexanediol, Hydroxyacetophenone, Ethylhexylglycerin

title: I'm from Licorice Clear Pad 200ml, 60 Toner Pads, 87% Korean Licorice, Calming & Gentle Exfoliating Toning Pads for Breakouts, Soothing, Hydrating for Sensitive & Irritated Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
content:
Korean beauty brand I'm From made these jumbo licorice toner pads and I am so glad to have discovered them. They are textured on one side and smooth on the other and saturate the product nicely without being too drippy. I love that they came with a little tool to grab one out so I don't have to use my fingers and potentially contaminate the other pads.

I did experience a little bit of dryness/irritation on my chin after using these pads but it hasn't affected any other areas of my skin. Overall, they felt very soothing, cleansing, and refreshing to use.

title: I'm from Licorice Clear Pad 200ml, 60 Toner Pads, 87% Korean Licorice, Calming & Gentle Exfoliating Toning Pads for Breakouts, Soothing, Hydrating for Sensitive & Irritated Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
content:
I've been using these for about a week. I was really nervous to try them because they have grapefruit and orange oils which can be irritating to the skin. I believe they are the major exfoliators in the product.

I have really sensitive skin and have reactions to many common products like coconut oil or niacinamide, however I didn't have any issues with this. I probably would prefer something without the essential oils and just the licorice to make sure my skin doesn't ever develop an allergy. However I do have uneven texture on my forehead and that has been slightly improved. There's no guarantee it's from this product as hormones can change things as well.

Overall I'm happy with the product and will use it until I run out. I'll have to see if I notice consistent changes over time in order to fully recommend it. I do think if you have sensitive skin you could use this 1-2 times a week and that would be sufficient for at least getting rid of some of the dead skin cells.

I prefer this product to their rice mask that has little rice granules in it. That product actually cuts my skin and causes irritation. This is much more gentle.

Edit* It's been over a month later and I actually love these. I think they have been one of the things that have led to smoother skin texture for me. I feel like it's the effects most people get from acids, but acids are generally too strong for me. This is both soothing and exfoliating. I am definitely tempted to repurchase in the future. This product finally lives up to the hype I'd heard from the brand and I'm really happy I kept with trying these. I would prefer this in a bottle vs pads as it's better for the environment, but the pads are nice if you are in a rush or traveling.

title: I'm from Licorice Clear Pad 200ml, 60 Toner Pads, 87% Korean Licorice, Calming & Gentle Exfoliating Toning Pads for Breakouts, Soothing, Hydrating for Sensitive & Irritated Skin

title: I'm from Licorice Clear Pad 200ml, 60 Toner Pads, 87% Korean Licorice, Calming & Gentle Exfoliating Toning Pads for Breakouts, Soothing, Hydrating for Sensitive & Irritated Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
content:
I am a K-beauty aficionado and also purchase another product by I'm from regularly, so I really wanted to try this out. Licorice has many bio-active compounds that have anti-inflammatory, brightening (by slowing melanin production), and anti-oxidant (which helps reduce damage that causes aging) properties. It's especially recommended for sensitive, reddened skin. I'm from uses a traditional extraction process that results in more bioactives in the final product. These pads also have some compounds found in Centella asiatica (cica, tiger grass) which is also great to soothe and help with inflammation.

These toner pads have a textured and smooth side so you can lightly move across your skin to gently exfoliate and/or use the smooth side to gently pat on/leave on for a couple of minutes. I found they left my skin feeling smooth and refreshed. I always squeeze out any excess toner and use it on my hands when I'm done so I don't waste any, and I also thought these soothed my hands, which happened to be a little irritated after some house cleaning chores.

This has mild fragrance. It lingers for a short time, and one of the fragrance ingredients is orange peel oil, which can cause allergies/irritation in some and garners a rating of 7 on EWG because of that. It also has grapefruit peel oil, which is a bit less problematic for allergies/irritation and gets a EWG score of 3. Yuka, which doesn't penalize fragrance ingredients as much, gives this a 93/100.

These are really 4.5 stars for me since I've also used some amazing toner pads and I don't think these will displace those from my top picks, but I am rounding up to 5 for the high quality ingredients from a reputable brand.

Note: someone gave this a bad review because they got it in their eyes. This product says on the box to avoid the eye area; it's meant to be used after cleansing as a toner step (cleanse, tone, serum/ampoule, moisturizer, and sunscreen (AM only)).
