Which is known to potentially irritate your skin. I have very sensitive skin and multiple allergies and so far this has been very gentle and doesn‚Äôt irritate my skin at all. It does a great job removing dirt and oils without drying out my skin. It‚Äôs hydrating, loaded with serum, and leaves my face feeling smooth and bright.

title: I'm From Licorice Calming Cream 1.59 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2024
content: Since using this cream, I have seen a reduction of redness and flushness on my face. Not my face is a softer pink and not the red blotchiness. They call this a cream, but the consistency feels more like a lotion, not heavy feeling at all. It blends well with other facial serums and products, and leaves a soft moisturizing glow on my face.

title: I'm From Licorice Calming Cream 1.59 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2024
content:
This comes in a nice outer product box that‚Äôs sealed. It‚Äôs made in Korea. Ingredients on the tube aren‚Äôt in English BUT they do have them in English on the outer product box, so that‚Äôs nice at least. There‚Äôs an expiration date on it (for me it is 9/17/26). It comes in a nice squeeze tube that has a tinfoil safety seal beneath the lid.

The main ingredient in this is actually Glycyrrhiza Uralensis (Licorice) Root Extract (Ricorice Exosome) and it even gives the concentration - 58%. The next ingredient is water. I liked seeing Licorice was actually the first ingredient, and really liked they included the amount too! This also has another type of licorice extract in it - Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract as the 9th ingredient. On the ingredient list on the box, it doesn‚Äôt state the percentage of this. But the ingredient list on the product page says it‚Äôs 0.05%. The 23rd ingredient is Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, which is actual licorice. Again, the ingredient list on the box doesn‚Äôt give the concentration, but the ingredient list here on the product page says 1,000ppm. Just for reference, 1ppm = 0.0001% (or 10,000 ppm = 1%). So 1,000 ppm means 0.1%. So there‚Äôs quite a few different types of licorice root extracts as well as actual licorice.

This has a very subtle scent to it. I‚Äôm guessing from the licorice? But it‚Äôs hard to place because it‚Äôs so faint. This is more like a gel than a cream to me. I have dry skin. When it‚Äôs colder, my skin gets extremely dry. So I prefer creams since they‚Äôre usually heavier and more moisturizing for me. Gel creams are usually thinner and more lightweight, so they usually aren‚Äôt moisturizing enough for me. This definitely is thin and lightweight. It feels nice going on. It glides on the skin easily. It absorbs quickly. There‚Äôs no residue or tacky feeling left on the skin. To me, this doesn‚Äôt live up to the ‚Äúintense hydration‚Äù claim. Right now my skin is really dry and this isn‚Äôt moisturizing enough. However, I find it works well enough to use before makeup. It‚Äôs thin and lightweight, which is usually best for under makeup. I do my usual skincare routine when I first wake up, using a different moisturizer at the end of it. I let that settle in for about 30 minutes (more if I can). Then right before applying my makeup, I‚Äôll apply a thin layer of this to get a little extra moisturizing and this has been working well for me when used that way. I feel in the summer when my skin is more normal leaning dry, this will work well as my main moisturizer. But right now, as my main moisturizer, I need something more hydrating than this. This would probably be great for those with normal or oily skin. But for people like me with really dry skin, I don‚Äôt think this is enough.

I also don‚Äôt think it lived up to the ‚Äúreduction in redness‚Äù claim. It says that this ‚Äúcontains oil-soluble Licorice extract with a certified skin tone-evening effect that minimizes redness and pigmentation scars. Enhance your skin's radiance and evenness.‚Äù So far, this hasn‚Äôt helped reduce my redness or reduce pigmentation from scars (post acne marks). Maybe with continued use it will. But as of now, it hasn‚Äôt done that.

Overall, I like it but don‚Äôt love it. Like I said, it might work better for me when my skin is more normal leaning dry. But given this claimed to give ‚Äúintense hydration‚Äù - I just don‚Äôt think it lives up to that. If you‚Äôre looking for something with intense hydration, I don‚Äôt think this is it. But if you‚Äôre looking for a lightweight cream that has a kind of gel consistency, this would work well.

INGREDIENTS
Glycyrrhiza Uralensis (Licorice) Root Extract (58%), Water, Propanediol, Glycerin, Phenyl Trimethicone, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, 1,2-Hexanediol, Chlorella Vulgaris Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract (0.05%), Cynanchum Atratum Extract, Althaea Rosea Flower Extract, Pentylene Glycol, Panthenol, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Vinyl Dimethicone, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Glucose, Tromethamine, Butylene Glycol, Dimethiconol, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate (1,000ppm), Fructooligosaccharides, Fructose, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Ethylhexylglycerin, Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Sorbitan Isostearate, Sodium Phytate, Cellulose Gum, Silica, Cetearyl Olivate, Ceramide NP, Sorbitan Olivate, Tocopherol, Kanzou Furabonoido (JPN) (1ppb), Xanthan Gum

title: I'm From Licorice Calming Cream 1.59 Fl Oz

****About me: Integrity is very important to me. Reviews I've posted will be from items I've had direct contact with. These are my honest opinions. I will not post a review for a product I have not had personal contact with.

I‚Äôm not sure what causes the cooling sensation when first applied as there isn‚Äôt any mint or menthol that I can find, but it doesn‚Äôt burn or sting, and it goes away after a couple seconds.

INGREDIENTS:
Glycyrrhiza Uralensis (Licorice) Root Extract, Water(58%), Propanediol, Glycerin, Phenyl Trimethicone, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, 1,2-Hexanediol, Chlorella Vulgaris Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract(0.05%), Cynanchum Atratum Extract, Althaea Rosea Flower Extract, Pentylene Glycol, Panthenol, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Vinyl Dimethicone, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Glucose, Tromethamine, Butylene Glycol, Dimethiconol, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate(1,000ppm), Fructooligosaccharides, Fructose, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Ethylhexylglycerin, Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Sorbitan Isostearate, Sodium Phytate, Cellulose Gum, Silica, Cetearyl Olivate, Ceramide NP, Sorbitan Olivate, Tocopherol, Kanzou Furabonoido(JPN)(1ppb), Xanthan Gum

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz

I like that this serum is lightweight and fast-absorbing. I use it day and night as needed, whenever my skin needs something to calm it down. This is also great after exfoliating. title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
content:
I like this Licorice ampoule/serum which is meant as a twice daily skin treatment. title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz

content: This is a really nice product that works well for my skin. I have uneven skin tone and some redness, mostly due to aging I believe. I don‚Äôt struggle with wrinkles but I do have to deal with the uneven skin tone, redness and large pores with a lot of oily skin. This has helped my skin a lot with the redness and it seems like my skin has become brighter and overall less uneven. I like that it has no scent, it‚Äôs a great addition to my routine.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
content:
Licorice is a star botanical for skincare with many bioactive compounds. It has soothing, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant properties. It's especially recommended for sensitive, reddened skin. Beta-sitosterol also has shown anti-inflammatory properties in studies, and malt extract contains antioxidant phenols, so it can help soothe troubled skin and protect against damage that causes aging. Because I have reactive skin, I was excited to try this. I found that this product left my skin feeling baby smooth and was soothing. It left a slight stickiness for a few minutes, probably not enough to interfere with makeup application (although I can't test since I don't wear foundation), but it was completely absorbed in about 15 minutes.

I'm from is a reputable Korean beauty brand, and I use one of their other products regularly. I'm from uses a traditional extraction process that results in more bioactives in the final product.

One thing I find frustrating is that so many products marked to sensitive skin have a ton of fragrance ingredients which are notorious for irritating sensitive skin. Thankfully, there are products like this that buck the trend with no added fragrance and have a relatively short ingredient list. With the exception of licorice, all the ingredients are EWG green. Because licorice really has bioactives, it garners an EWG score of 4, but note that retinols also get more cautionary scores because they actually do something. Licorice, in studies, is very promising for skin, and unless you have an allergy to it, which is always possible, I think it's a highly desired ingredient for many skincare needs.

This has a very mild smell from the ingredients. Instead of smelling like licorice, it had a sweet smell to me that surprised me. Looking over the ingredient list, I think it might be from the malt extract since it reminds me of the scent I get when tasting diluted distilled malt, with maybe just a hint of the sweet part of fresh fennel root (but not the "licorice" part). It is very mild and dissipates quickly. I smell things more acutely than the vast majority of people, so I recommend this to those who are scent-sensitive like me.

If there is some confusion over ampoules vs serums, know there is NO official definition as these are more marketing terms than anything (one reviewer apparently objected to the terminology). This can justly be called an ampoule based on the high concentration, 73%, of licorice, but you can incorporate it in your routine as needed. I experience unexplained redness/rashes from apparently environmental, non-skincare products regularly, so I plan on incorporating this in my arsenal of products to quickly soothe my irritated skin.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
content: I like this; it‚Äôs silky, not too thick, absorbs quickly and doesn‚Äôt feel sticky. Lightweight formula that works well for morning skin care; doesn‚Äôt take forever to dry and leaves my skin feeling smooth and soft, I felt that it created a nice base for primer and foundation.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
content: I am entirely pleased with this product (Licorice Soothing Ampoule) so far and find it very soothing to my skin. The liquid is sheer and unscented with just a little sticky after-feel and it comes in a bottle that makes dispensing easy. I was surprised to see how quickly I felt improvements in the comfort and feel of my skin.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2024
content: This brand has many great products that I've enjoyed using so I thought I'd give this soother ampoule a try. The bottle looks great and the dispenser is convenient. The bottle is pretty unique because it actually took me a few mins to figure out how to use it. I kept pumping it expecting something to come out from the top, but it's actually a twist off where I can just pump it onto my face directly. The ampoule does a good job at soothing my face after it's red from other products.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
content: Ok I got this on a whim even though I'm not a fan of licorice scent. Happy to report it does not smell at all like licorice! This is an ampoule which is like a serum but way more potent..so even though directions say am/pm, I only apply a few times a week just as a bonus mix into my normal routine. It's on the pricey side but for the potency and how long it will last, it's worth it.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
content: I'm From Licorice Soothing Ampoule helps make my skin feel amazingly smooth and soft. It comes in a very unique bottle -- when you unscrew the lid, the top pops up. When you press down on the top, the liquid is dispensed through the dropper. Be careful - it's easy to shoot that liquid out and make a mess. The ampoule has no discernible scent. It's not a thick, gooey liquid like some and absorbs into your skin quite quickly.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
content:
Made in Korea, one of the countries I trust for quality. (USA, Western Europe, Japan would be others)

"I'm From" has a large number of beauty products on Amazon, some of them with thousands of great reviews.

Virtually no scent, which is good, I'm sensitive to strong scents.

I tried on some red/blotchy skin. It had a noticeable improvement but of course the skin did not 100% get repaired.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
content:
MY ‚≠êÔ∏èRATINGS:
3‚≠êÔ∏è- NOT BAD. I definitely would recommend it as a second resort

When I got this serum (ampoule is small capsules, which this is not), the box was sealed, but the cap wasn‚Äôt on tight, so a minimal amount had leaked and dried up.

Licorice root extract is well known for brightening, calming redness, and soothing. I like that this serum has a simple ingredient list and is fragrance-free, which is good for my sensitive skin.

This serum is lightweight and absorbs quickly. It doesn‚Äôt seem to soothe my skin all day, and I find myself cleansing my skin early in the evening and applying my usual nightly serums, which this is not.

HOW I USE: AM
1 - Cleanse my face,
2 - I apply 4 drops of this serum (ampoule) on my face.
I always dry my face & hands thoroughly before applying any serums. Then, I ensure the serum absorbs into my skin before applying moisturizer. If I don‚Äôt, I get a sticky, icky feel.
3 - LAST, I finish with my usual moisturizer.

I'm From Licorice Soothing Ampoule works well with the other skincare products that are part of my facial regimen.

EXPIRATION DATE: 02/07/2026
I always check for an expiration date before using, ESPECIALLY with health & beauty products.

This serum is exactly as advertised, and works well. The PRICE is in the usual range.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
content: It's a good ampoule I use after my serum and before my moisturizer. There's a light herbal scent to it, I liked that. It's easy absorb into my skin especially the cheeks, easy to spread and you only need 2-3 drops to cover your face (I have a chubby large face). It's no super thin like a toner, just slightly thicker but not heavy. My skin is soft and it feels good. I'm going to use it in the mornings.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
content:
Product is unsealed. It has a little piece of tape on one end, but the other is easily openable. I'd like to see this addressed in the future.

Korean skincare is among the best I've tried. This is a ampoule. I absolutely love that Licorise Root is the primary ingredient (at 73%). Ampoules, from my understanding, are similar to serums, but they are more potent. So they aren't used every day, like a serum, but are more for when you just need something extra. However this ampoule instructs to use it daily morning and at night. I would not want to run out of it.

The ampoule absorbs quickly. My skin is much softer from it. It also feels light and watery going on. But leaves a soft barrier on my skin.

I really like this product and will most likely continue to use it, but I would like to see the product sealed better.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
content: "I'm From" brand's Licorice Soothing Ampoule offers a pleasantly understated scent, surprisingly devoid of any licorice notes given the name. The serum absorbs quickly into the skin, providing relief and smoothness to irritated areas of my skin. It took me a little while to figure out that the lid that I kept popping up and down is actually the top of the dropper, so unscrew the cap and you will see. I‚Äôm quite happy with this.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
content:
I really wanted to like this product and even tried it 3 separate times (with weeks in-between) to see if I was crazy or not but all three times, my skin did not like it. It gave me little bumps, which is a shame because I love another line of products from this brand.

Despite it not working, I still give it 3 stars because it applies well, absorbs great, and doesn't leave any tackiness. It's also not fragranced, which is a huge plus for me! Might help with redness with prolonged use but I'm not willing to test that out.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
content:
While it's not a miracle worker or an instant fix, this serum does seem to calm the redness in my cheeks. I've been using it fairly consistently for the past few weeks, and have noticed less redness when I use it. Especially if i apply it in the evening, when I wake up I have less redness than usual.

It is a very lightweight, 'watery' formula, with little to no scent which I prefer. Absorbs into the skin very quickly, does not leave a residue or pill when used with other skincare products.

The bottle / packaging is cute- a green glass bottle with a pump style dropper dispenser. When you uscrew the top, the plunger for the dropper pops up.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
content:
I didn't see a huge improvement when using this I'm From product.
Their products generally fare quite well but for the liquorice ampoule, i didn't see a measurable difference in my skin's texture + hydration
I guess most importantly, it didnt cause any breakouts or adverse effects so i would generally recommend this to someone to try but for me personally, it did not move the needle.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
content: The I'm From Licorice Soothing Ampoule has a great design and comes in a 1oz dropper. When using it, you twist the neck of the dropper, and the top draws up an ideal amount of the serum. You get about a nickel-sized amount when you dispense it into your hand‚Äîmore than enough to lightly massage it over the face and neck. Slightly more viscous than water. The serum is transparent with a hint of yellow; otherwise, it is odorless, non-irritating, and not sticky or unpleasant. I have mature, dry, sensitive skin, and this serum works well for my needs. Can be used AM and or PM and pairs well with the rest of my skincare.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
content: I don‚Äôt think I have ever used a skincare product made from licorice. It has some great benefits for your skin! It‚Äôs calming and helps keep my skin from getting red throughout the day. I think my skin will only get better if I use this religiously and for an extended period of time.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
content: This is a really nice licorice serum. It is moisturizing and doesn't leave my skin feeling sticky. Perfect for both, day and night use.

title: I'm from Licorice Soothing Ampoule, 73% Korean Licorice, Exosome, Non-comedogenic 1.01 Fl Oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
content:
I am in my late 40's with extremely dry and sensitive skin.
This arrives nicely boxed with a sealed top, but the bottom is completely unsealed and can easily be opened and reclosed without being able to tell. There is no seal on the bottle so there is effectively no tamper protection at all.
This has a tinted glass bottle to protect it from light damage. The lid has a unique design - twist and it will pop up a button which when pressed will pull up the ampoule. Although fun and good for travel, this limits it - it is impossible to release a single drop or less than the button pulls up. The dropper is bulb-tipped.
The serum is clear and thin. There is no scent that I could tell. It sinks into my skin without rubbing or tugging and leaves my skin smooth - no stickiness or shine.
I don't find this moisturizing at all, and haven't really seen any improvement in my skin, but I haven't been using it too long. I also haven't had any negative reactions from my sensitive skin - no redness, peeling, itching or breakouts. Am going to continue to use to see if there are any benefits. If not, will not repurchase.

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml

I have Oily/Dry skin (sometimes sensitive to harsher chemicals) and I've used other I'm from Mugwort products. They've always absorbed and retained well for me! This one is no different.

content:
I haven't really heard about mugwort so I had to do some reading on this ingredient/herb. Mugwort is regarded as a healing herbal weed known for its antibacterial, anti fungal and skin protective properties. It has antioxidant properties that protects skin from sun damage. It has deep moisturizing properties.

I've been using this for more than a week now and I noticed improvement on my face as it feels hydrated and fresh. I apply this after cleaning my face. It's nice that it doesn't have a scent and it doesn't feel sticky after application. No irritation on my skin so far. I'm impressed.

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
content: The serum didn't have any noticeable scent. It came with a dropper and it gave a good amount of serum with each squeeze. The serum smoothed on easily and didn't leave skin feeling tacky or sticky. The serum felt very soothing and it didn't pill when I applied product on top of it.

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
content: I have never tried a product with Mugwart before (that I know of anyway) so I was intrigued. I also love Korean skincare products, so I jumped at the chance to try this serum. First off, there is NO scent to it- at all. I don't know if I have a sensitive olfactory but even products that say "fragrance-free" have a bit of some sort of scent from whatever ingredients are used. I was quite surprised that it had literally no scent at all to me. I spread it onto my face, which felt really nice. One of the biggest things I hate about some facial products is when it leaves a sticky or greasy feeling, and I was really surprised this one did. That bummed me out because I really cannot stand that feeling. I thought maybe it was because I used a face wipe to clean my face rather than a cleanser (I was being lazy) so I tried it on the back of my hands which are very dry from the cold weather. I had high hopes, but, while it was not as bad as on my face, it did have a bit of an off-feeling to me. After waiting a while, my face did seem to absorb it a bit more, so it wasn't as sticky as it previously was... I want to love it, I do... but with that said, I don't hate it either. It actually did help the dry areas on my hand, which is why I am torn.

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml

Giving this 4 stars since it's working so well for others, and I can't say definitively if it's irritating my skin.

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
content: I have been using this mugwort serum for days now and I can attest that it has done a very good job at calming my skin which had become angry since the winter weather has kicked into high gear. This serum goes on easily and leaves my skin feeling hydrated and smooth without being sticky. I like that this serum has no scent. I use this serum after I cleanse and tone to create a calming base for my other products. I have noticed an improvement in my skin since using this serum. Areas that were irritated from wearing hats and masks have been restored to normal and my skin's appearance has evened out. Overall, I am highly impressed with this serum and will continue to use it on my skin for its calming effects.

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
content:
The I'm From Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract has a lot of great ingredients including the Mugwort extract.

I love that it has a large percentage of Mugwort extract for calming the skin and it also has a lot of other great quality ingredients like; Niacinamide, Hexanadiol - so it's a very well-rounded serum.

It went on very smoothly and I did not feel any stickiness. It left my skin feeling very soft and moisturized. I love this serum because I am using a product with Retinol that's very irritating to the skin and this product very much calmed down my skin and the redness.

Overall a great quality serum.

title: I'm from Mugwort Serum, 57% Calming serum for face with 57% Korean mugwort extract great for soothing, Sensitive, irritated skin, Water gel texture without stickiness, 1.01 fl.oz / 30ml

content:
I'm a big fan of the I'm From Mugwort Mask (and the brand in general). It is one of my favorite products for irritated, over-exfoliated skin. I ordered this to use more day-to-day since my skin gets drier and problematic in the winter.

I was a little worried that this might have a scent, since the mask smells really 'earthy' but it is pretty much unscented as described. It is also non-sticky, so it can be used both day and night. It doesn't affect my other skincare products and I haven't had any issues with pilling. It absorbs very quickly and feels calming. I look forward to seeing if this improves my overall skin condition over the winter. The price for this serum is good since you only need a dropper. The bottle should last a while. Hope this helps!

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
content: I ordered this Korean Mugwort 57% Calming serum for the face because I heard Korean skincare was great so I wanted to give it a try. So I have been using it daily for the last three weeks. Quite honestly, I don't really see much of a change in my skin condition (not that my skin is bad). My skin might feel a bit more softer but that's about it. I will keep using it for another week or so and see if there are any changes.

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
content:
I'm From Mugwort Serum, 57% Korean mugwort extract

This serum is very soothing to the skin and also boosts hydration. If you have sensitive skin or irritated skin, this is very nice to use. I also like to use it when I've been using acids, retinol or other actives so that I don't end up loading too many potentially irritating ingredients at once.

content: Scentless, lightweight, and very moisturizing on my combo skin. Added flawlessly into my skincare routine for more moisture, and the ingredients have great benefits for your skin. Had no adverse reactions, and I do enjoy using it daily. Highly recommend this reputable brand.

title: I'm From Rice Toner 5.07 Fl Oz + Mugwort Essence 1.01 Fl Oz, Travel Friendly, Glowing and Calming Duo, Korean Skincare, Dry, Dull Combination Skin, Korean Rice and Mugwort Extracts
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2024
content: My skin breaks out if the wind blows in the wrong direction so to find 2 product that actually make it better with no negative side effects is a miracle. The toner is great for redness and it literally makes it go away before your eyes like an infomercial. I use the mugwort essence before bed when I have blemishes coming on and they look much better in the morning. Both of these products are great on their own and don't necessarily need to be used together.

You really only need to use a very small amount for a nice lather, probably much less than you would expect to use. For dry skin, it‚Äôs not overly hydrating, but presumably following up with the other products regardless of brand, it will more responsible for locking in moisture.

The tube comes sealed and expiration appears to be 2027.

My initial impression is very good, I‚Äôm looking forward to continue using it and other items in the ‚ÄúI‚Äôm From‚Äù line.

‚â° Value
All things considered, this is a fairly decent cleanser that cleanse reasonably well albeit it still leaves my skin a bit dry for my liking although it's not worse than most others. It's somewhat reasonably priced at $24 (150 ml/5.07 fl.oz) in comparison to many other equally effective facial cleansers or gels with similar performance, if not better.

content:
This cleanser is perhaps the gentlest facial cleanser I‚Äôve ever used. In the past, several so-called gentle cleansers have set my skin on fire (metaphorically). Even cleansers that are generally good can sting when I‚Äôve overtaxed my skin. The rice whip cleanser lathers well, cleans effectively, and rinses completely. It is a big winner for me! I‚Äôm just not sure if I can justify the level of expenditure. title: I'm from Rice Whip Facial Cleanser Set, 3 pcs Gift, Travel Kit with Rice Face Wash 5.07 fl oz & 1.01 fl oz & Rice Toner 1.01 fl oz, low-pH Rice Water Face Wash for sensitive, dry skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
content:
This cleanser set comes with two sizes of the same face wash (a full size and a travel size) plus a travel size toner. I have sensitive skin and rosacea, and upon using the combo of this face wash and toner, my face immediately showed patches of red dots on the cheek areas. After the red irritations were gone, I retried the products again wanting to know whether the skin irritations were caused by the face wash or the toner, so I used them separately at different times.

The face wash is actually fine. It lathers well under water and smooth on the face. But as far as cleansing goes, the result is no different from other cleansers that I have used - this one is not particularly hydrated or showing obvious good results in reducing pores.

The toner, I believe, was the one that caused my skin irritation. I used it again followed by cleansing my face with my normal facial cleanser, and soon the red patches showed up again on my cheeks. So for whatever reason, the ingredients in this toner do not sit well on my skin. I will probably not going to use this set of products again. It might work for someone else, but just not for me.

title: I'm from Rice Whip Facial Cleanser Set, 3 pcs Gift, Travel Kit with Rice Face Wash 5.07 fl oz & 1.01 fl oz & Rice Toner 1.01 fl oz, low-pH Rice Water Face Wash for sensitive, dry skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2024
content:
4 ¬Ω stars rounded up to 5. The 150 ml / 5.08 oz Rice Whip Facial Cleanser, and a small travel set of the same cleanser and a Rice Toner, were thoughtfully arranged inside a sealed box. The box lists ingredients and directions (English only with one line of Korean text). There‚Äôs no ingredient list on the individual items, but each has directions in English along with some Korean text. A bit of the English text is awkwardly worded. All three items had silver safety seals under their lids.

I followed the somewhat vague cleanser directions to ‚Äúapply a certain amount onto wet hands and create lather. Gently massage the lather onto wet skin‚Ä¶‚Äù Not sure what a ‚Äúcertain amount‚Äù was, I used more than I should have the first time. A very small amount of this soft, foamy cleanser was enough to create a lather that easily covered my face and neck. To my nose there‚Äôs a slight scent (that I can‚Äôt name) as I‚Äôm actively washing my face, and then it‚Äôs gone. There‚Äôs no vague ‚Äúfragrance‚Äù ingredient in either product.

The 1.01 oz milky-white toner is small, but there‚Äôs enough to figure out if you like it if it‚Äôs a new product to you. It‚Äôs lightweight and it absorbs quickly for me, but you need to remember to shake it first, which I‚Äôm not a fan of. To my nose this toner is unscented.

These were my first rice/rice bran extract products, and my acne-prone, combination skin liked them. For me they were both gentle and lightly moisturizing. The cleanser cleaned my face well, and both products left my skin feeling balanced. My acne-prone skin really likes niacinamide/vitamin B3, which is in both products (and in the active I followed these up with in the mornings), and I experienced no irritation, redness, or spots after using both for a week.

‚ÄúVegan friendly‚Äù and cruelty free per the brand, but the only marking is ‚ÄúVegan‚Äù on the toner. The products I received in June 2024 were all marked with icons stating they should be good for at least 12 months. Each also had an EXP date in March 2027. Made in Korea

title: I'm from Rice Whip Facial Cleanser Set, 3 pcs Gift, Travel Kit with Rice Face Wash 5.07 fl oz & 1.01 fl oz & Rice Toner 1.01 fl oz, low-pH Rice Water Face Wash for sensitive, dry skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024
content:
This is a very gentle cleanser that lathers well. I don't have sensitive skin, but it seems like it would be good for that. It feels soft on your skin but still cleanses it. The pack also comes with an ample amount of travel-size face wash. The cleanser seems like a good cleanser to use.

I don't know how I feel about the toner. You must shake it first before applying it. The toner is liquid so that you could use a cotton square. I prefer to pour it on my hand and rub it in. It does not leave your skin feeling smooth, and I have another that does, so I may not finish the bottle.

I recommend trying this product. In the future, I may purchase the face wash again. However, I will not be buying the toner.

I like the simple, modern, and pinkish packaging that repeats the fig theme.
Be aware that this cleanser does contain fragrance, so if your skin is sensitive, you may want to patch test first.

title: I‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser, Korean Daily Gentle Face Wash for Oily, Sensitive Skin, Sebum Control, Mild Alkaline, Creamy Bubble, Lather, Exfoliating, Vegan, Hydrating, Pore Cleansing 5.07 fl oz

content: Wonderful smell. Need to use much less product than my regular soap. Skin feels smooth after use. I have very dry skin, and even though this says it's for oily skin, it doesn't feel drying for me. I want to try the mugwort one next though.

title: I‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser, Korean Daily Gentle Face Wash for Oily, Sensitive Skin, Sebum Control, Mild Alkaline, Creamy Bubble, Lather, Exfoliating, Vegan, Hydrating, Pore Cleansing 5.07 fl oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2024
content: I like this cleanser because a little goes a long way. just a dot and you have a nice lather on your skin and then it's easy to rinse and leaves your skin fresh and hydrated. No irritation and a good purchase for K-skincare fans! I love it.

title: I‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser, Korean Daily Gentle Face Wash for Oily, Sensitive Skin, Sebum Control, Mild Alkaline, Creamy Bubble, Lather, Exfoliating, Vegan, Hydrating, Pore Cleansing 5.07 fl oz

I still use my regular moisturizer after though. I don't use this every day but have added this into a rotation of regular cleansing, as I do really like it.

title: I‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser, Korean Daily Gentle Face Wash for Oily, Sensitive Skin, Sebum Control, Mild Alkaline, Creamy Bubble, Lather, Exfoliating, Vegan, Hydrating, Pore Cleansing 5.07 fl oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024
content: Love the scent, it's a nice balanced fruity floral scent that is also refreshing to use at the end of the day. The cleanser foamed up nicely, cleansed well and away without leaving my skin feeling overly cleansed. I did not experience any irritation afterwards.

title: I‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser, Korean Daily Gentle Face Wash for Oily, Sensitive Skin, Sebum Control, Mild Alkaline, Creamy Bubble, Lather, Exfoliating, Vegan, Hydrating, Pore Cleansing 5.07 fl oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2024
content: This fig foam cleanser smells so nice to me. You only need a tiny bit to lather up, so I tried this on my face and body. I felt like I had to moisturize shortly after I dried down.

title: I‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser, Korean Daily Gentle Face Wash for Oily, Sensitive Skin, Sebum Control, Mild Alkaline, Creamy Bubble, Lather, Exfoliating, Vegan, Hydrating, Pore Cleansing 5.07 fl oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2024
content: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser‚Äù is a rich, foamy face cleanser. My face feels clean but not dry after using it. I feel like it did a good job removing makeup, grime, and all the rest that accumulates on my face during the day. It compares well to a brand name cleanser that I tried. It smells good, slightly sweet & fruity, but not strong. It‚Äôs not a floral scent. The scent doesn‚Äôt linger after rinsing. I do find it a little bit hard to thoroughly rinse off. I like to use a wet washcloth to gently remove, then rinse. One thing that is really good about this, is that a little goes a long way. It only takes a pea sized amount to clean my face. So, I think this is a pretty good value.

title: I‚Äôm from Fig Foam Cleanser, Korean Daily Gentle Face Wash for Oily, Sensitive Skin, Sebum Control, Mild Alkaline, Creamy Bubble, Lather, Exfoliating, Vegan, Hydrating, Pore Cleansing 5.07 fl oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2024
content: A little goes a long way, the cleanser is dense and will lather up nicely. The cleanser easily removed makeup and sunscreen without leaving residue or needing a second wash. My skin is very sensitive, with use my skin was neither dry or irritated with use. While my skin was a bit more hydrated than other cleansers, I still followed with a bit of moisturizer as is my normal routine.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2025
content: I really like these toning pads.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2025
content: My new go to toner pads. They feel and smell clean. Can actually be kept clean because of this great idea that is new to me. They are very saturated so one pad goes a long way - face, neck, decollete, and backs of hands.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
content: This rice toner is great, it is so soothing, it calms my skin after I have been under the sun, it feels so nice afterwards, it helps with healing your complexion. It doesn't dry my skin out at all, my skin feels hydrated and ready for the other products in my skin care routine. I like how they added tweezers to make it easier to remove the pads from the container without having to stick your fingers in and contaminating the rest.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2024
content: Very happy I bought these. Ordered more

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2024
content: The container for these toner pads is large. The rice formula feels very mild. No stinging or irritation when used regularly. The pads are soaking wet, so a lot of product in the container and no fear of them drying out.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024
content:
I like the ease of using pre-soaked toner pads. This product comes in a good sized container that snaps shut securely to prevent the pads from drying out. The entire stack of pads is saturated very well with toner. It's amazing how much product is in one thin pad when you use it on your skin. One pad is definitely plenty for your face and neck.

They have a very light scent. I do find that my skin has a slight tacky feeling to it after using these pads, but I believe that is because they are formulated to hydrate and moisturize. This is an advantage because a lot of other toners can dry out skin and strip moisture.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024
content: This is a good toner, I would consider the formula pretty simple/mild. I didn't have any irritation or sensitivity using them on my combination skin. The pads are quite wet, which is fine with me because I'd rather have to squeeze one out a bit than have to use multiple pads because they're too dry.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024
content:
As a note, I'm from Mugwort during the summer for a few days after extra sun exposure. It works well for me to offset the UV damage and irritation. As we go into fall, I decided to try I'm from rice for nourishment and smoothing.

Pros:
‚úÖ No reaction, nice and mild, feels cool and clean
‚úÖ Pads are thick and saturated, you can cover your whole face and neck
‚úÖ Very moisturizing, you sometimes don't need to follow up with cream. Definitely adds a bit of glow and works great under other glowing formulas
‚úÖ $28 is a reasonable price and is about what I expect to pay for pads of similar and premium quality

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024
content: I've used a lot of products from this brand and I've loved everything so far and this was no exception! They're nice thick pads and really wet. The product absorbs nicely into my skin. Great for daily use!

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024
content: First off, these toner pads are pretty small and thin, so that was a bit disappointing. But thankfully the toner itself is a nice liquidy mixture that leaves my skin feeling soft and nourished. There is no scent and no feeling of oiliness after application. Because the pads are so thin, it's sometimes hard to pull them apart from one another. I have been using these before bed after washing my face, and it's good to see that it cleanses my skin just a tad more, removing all traces of makeup and soap residue.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024
content: These toner pads work so well and they help my skin brightness. I have extremely sensitive skin and they don't cause any irritation like some other toner pads do. 10/10 recommend

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2024
content: These silky, soft rice toner pads are well tolerated on my sensitive skin. I used them usually after shaving (I'm a guy) and they add a refreshing feel to my face. No signs of redness or blemishes after I tried them a few times. They aren't very exfoliating like other pads, so these I used to sooth my skin. They do leave a silky residue that takes a few minutes to full soak into your skin. They do not have a fragrance and my sinuses are thankful. They include a pop top and tongs so you don't have to put your fingers into the container and contaminate it each time you use it, which is a nice addition.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2024
content: I am sure this is a great product but I personally had an allergic reaction to this and the rice serum! It makes my skin red and blotchy and itchy when using so I will not be using it anymore!

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
content: This brand makes such quality products. The toner pads are no exception. They came very well sealed and were easy to identify as authentic. The toner isn‚Äôt harsh, drying, strange smelling. There is quite a lot of moisture that can accompany each pad, this is great, just watch for drips. Also, take a minute and read the instructions. K-beauty toner pads are meant to be left on a ‚Äútrouble spot‚Äù to soak in and deliver all the product possible before swiping it about the face and discarding.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2024
content:
I'm no stranger to the popularity of I'm From's rice toner; I'd heard so many good things about it. As a K-beauty lover, I was very excited to try the rice toner pads.

The rice used in the toner is specially cultivated in Yeoju, Korea. The ingredient list itself is not a mile long, pretty tame compared to others. These are meant to help even skin tone and provide moisture.

For those wondering, it does list niacinamide as the 5th ingredient. However, the formula is incredibly gentle. I'm someone whose skin can't tolerate higher percentage niacinamide, but these have not irritated my skin at all. That being said, I have only been using them every other day as part of my AM routine. I needed to ensure my skin could handle it first, and it's going great so far. I'll probably start using them daily soon.

Skin type: combo leaning dry/dehydrated, type 1 rosacea on cheeks. I hate that I have additional texture on my cheeks, so I'm excited that my skin is handling the rice toner pads well. You can apply pads to the face and wear them for up to 30 minutes, or just pat them/swipe them over your face to soak in the toner. I typically do the latter, as I don't have time for the former lol.

Pros: so soothing, they feel great going on. Doesn't cause any separation or pilling under makeup or other skincare products. They really do add a nice additional layer of hydration, which my skin desperately needs. They seem to help calm down minor skin irritation. I've started a new moisturizer recently too, but I do have to say that my skin is looking more plump and brighter. Love the little tweezers and the packaging. Love that the toner soaks in easily and doesn't leave a film once dry.

Cons: can't really think of any! I really like these.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024
content: This toner feels really nice on my skin. It's clarifying and leaves it feeling hydrated. I love that it is fragrance free and truly gentle on my sensitive skin. There is TONS of moisture in each little pad, so I don't have a concern about these drying out or eventually being left with a container where only the pads on the bottom half of the container have any product left in them. The little tweezers to remove the pad from the stack are a nice touch, but they are still a little tough to grab individual sheets...so not sure how much more effective these are than just using your nails to grab them.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024
content: These toner pads feel very much like moisture masks - they are incredibly hydrating and have a wonderful feel on the skin. For someone like me with dry skin, that is a huge bonus. The ‚Äújar‚Äù is designed well and has a flip-top lid (once you remove the inner seal) that allows convenient access to the pads. Additionally, the tongs that come with the pads has a super handy, fitted a lot in the top of the jar that allows them to be neatly stored. The toner pads themselves are not what I would necessarily consider true toner pads- rather, they feel much more like super moisturizing serum pads. That is absolutely the only reason I am giving them a 4!instead of a 5. I still would recommend them with the caveat that I am doing so because they are truly moisturize and feel incredibly on my skin.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024
content: These toner pads come with 60 thin yet durable sheets. It includes a convenient plastic tweezer for easy access to each pad. The toner is formulated without fragrance. Despite their thinness, the pads are sturdy and hold up well during application. These pads are perfect for quick toning after cleansing, providing an easy way to prep my skin.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024
content: These are marketed as toner pads, but it's more like a sheet mask. However, it's easier to use. I put one pad on each check since these are my drier areas. They stayed on amazingly well. When done, I wiped the pads over my entire face and let the product sink in. It's more silky than normal toner. The pads felt nice while on an my skin felt smooth and fresh afterwards. No irritation at all. The tongs are also a nice touch - great design so they fit right inside the top for easy storage, as well as the fact that you don't risk contaminating the pads while trying to take one out.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
content: I've used various rice derived products on my skin for years (I've even made homemade rice bran masks) because they help to soothe my sensitive skin. These Korean "I'm from Rice" Toner Pads deliver the same results but in the convenience of a jar and pad that I can quickly swipe across my face. After using these, my skin looks calmer, more hydrated and more evenly toned. I've been using these as one would with any toner by applying them to my skin after cleansing, but before my serums and moisturizer. The product is a little thicker than a liquid toner, but not as thick as a serum and dries pretty quickly. It is unscented, which I appreciate as I am sensitive to smells.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2024
content:
These toner pads are ultra convenient and I prefer them over a sheet mask, both for comfort and since I have combination skin. I am able to put on a toner pad for each of my cheeks where my skin is driest, while not doing the oilier area in my T-zone. Much more comfortable than doing a whole sheet mask and easier to do more regularly.

You can also just swipe a pad over your whole face to get a layer of the product all over. The toner pads are soaked in a solution that is thicker than regular toner but slightly thinner than serum. It is absorbed quickly but does leave something behind on the skin afterward, so I think this is best for the cold and dry months. This is my overall impression of the I'm from Rice line- everything I've tried from it is very hydrating.

The pads come in a round plastic jar and there is a set of plastic tweezers that store in their own little holder on the inside of the lid. Makes it much easier and more hygienic to grab a single pad.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2024
content: This review is for the I‚Äôm From Rice toner pads. This comes in a nice size tub with a small set of plastic tweezers to pick up a pad. However, every time I tried to pick up just one toner pad, a whole little bundle would get picked up and I‚Äôd have to peel off the one that I wanted. I feel like it ends up being just as easy to pick it out with my fingers because either way, I‚Äôm handling more than just one of the pads at a time. It‚Äôs not heavily fragranced and the toner pads have a good amount of liquid. They sweep across my face easily and I didn‚Äôt feel any irritation. My face felt nicely moisturized afterwards, like I had applied a light serum almost. This is a much more convenient way of applying toner as compared to getting out a toner bottle and a cotton pad or ball.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2024
content: I wanted to try this a few days after receiving it. These are extremely thin and compact (less waste) toning sheets with a very pleasant solution. Tweezers included are needed to separate the thin sheets. Each sheet is sturdy, both exfoliates and tones well.. and as sensitive as my skin is (eczema prone)... there is a marked improvement in even tone and evenly hydrated appearance from the near immediate pore control. My skin is less itchy and significantly less morning break outs as of the 3rd day! So for my skin type (less pores, combination, high stress, eczema/rosacea prone with later life acne) .. this is gentle and apparently works well and quickly!

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024
content: Packaging came nicely sealed and jar itself was sealed. Easy to remove seal. Pads are a nice size - not too small and not too large. Each pad is soaked quite a bit and I often have e enough to place on top of hands and arms. Have been using for almost 2 weeks, and for me, no reactions to the pads. No fragrance, which I appreciate. Because have been using a short time, cannot comment on the skincare results of the product and that is the only reason for the 4 stars.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2024
content: These rice toner pads are awesome. The packaging includes a little plastic tweezer to pull out one pad at a time. The tweezers are stored above the pads when you open the flip top lip. The toner is smooth and fragrance free. The pad was saturated enough to do my face, neck, decolletage, and then there was a smidge left to put on my elbows and knees for extra smoothing in those areas. Love this brand and love this toner.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2024
content: I've been using rice toner on the regular for years. I switch out toner depending on what's up with my skin. This is super mild and just balances my skin out before I do other weird stuff to it. I'm a fan. Very good product. pads - for me - are easier than the liquid.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024
content: I feel like sometimes toner pads are inconvenient as I prefer a spray bottle for ease of use. I don‚Äôt think the little pad grabber is that great, it always falls somewhere when I open up the container. Otherwise, the toner itself is nice and the pads work well. You often need to use fingers to separate them which sucks, but the toner is decent and dries nicely on the skin after a minute or two so I can continue my skincare routine.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2024
content: Love grabbing these after cleansing my face!

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2024
content: These I'm from Rice Toner Pads are super nice. They have a pretty neutral scent are are well saturated with the toner/serum. Refreshing to use. After using there is a very slight tackiness that disappears quickly. Not at all drying. My skin feels soft after using, even when I don't follow up with moisturizer.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2024
content: I can get really dry skin if I use water on my skin too often. We do have hard water here, so I'm sure that's part of it. I've actually found that these toner pads are really good for cleaning my face. I wipe down my face with one side of the pad, rinse and dry with a cotton towel, and then wipe my face again with the other side of the pad, depositing more toner. I don't think this is for everyone (I tend not to get clogged pores, and I don't wear much makeup), but it has worked really well for me. The toner is really hydrating, and I find that these are really nice to keep with me for after exercise or sun exposure.

title: I'm from Rice Toner Pads 140ml, 60 Sheets, Triple-Layered Pads, Rice Extract from Korea, for Dry and Rough Skin
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2024
content: If you love the rice toner, get all the goodness in a pad! These are very juicy and offer deep hydration. Unlike the toner, you can leave this on the skin longer for a quick 5 min sheet mask treatment. I love to do this when the weather is dry and cold, when my skin is likely to lose more moisturizer than normal. I personally love how plump and soft my skin looks when I'm done masking with these. Because they're so hydrating and calming, I sometimes apply it to my cheeks when I get a flareups and it also cuts down on the amount of products I apply afterwards. Highly recommend these if you use toner pads!

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
content:
The I'm From Vitamin Tree Water Gel is a lighter version of Neutrogena's Hydroboost gel cream. The cream doesn't have fragrance and glides easily over the skin. It's much lighter and doesn't irritate my skin. I don't think the cream by itself is enough to keep my skin hydrated. It works well under a thicker cream at night. During the day, it works well under sunscreen.
The active ingredients (niacinamide, panthenol and vitamin C) has helped keep my acne skin calm and less inflamed when I'm going through a hormonal break out.

Overall, I think it's a comparable cream to many Korean gel creams I've used. It's safe and from a reputable brand and I think it's affordable. Would consider repurchasing as part of my permanent skincare regiment.

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2025
content: This moisturizer is so smooth and lightweight. I love it. It's like a gel that it just glide on smoothly and giving my skin the moisture it needs, it leaves a nice glow. I also love that it's hygienic with it's packaging that it gives me the pieces of mind to use on my skin. I have sensitive skin, this product did not irritate my skin which is a huge plus. The scent is mild,not too bothersome to me.

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2024
content: I LOVE this moisturizer! I have super oily skin, and heavy creams and serums tend to sit on top of my skin instead of sinking in. This gel moisturizer sinks in quickly and doesn't leave any sort of stick residue or shine behind. It's quickly becoming my favorite moisturizer - I use it every single morning!

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2024
content: The I'm From brand is probably best known for its mugwort and rice lines, so I was excited to try a different product as I've never used skincare with the vitamin tree extract. This gel cream is very light and almost odorless and absorbs easily. I like that it feels soothing and cool on my sensitive skin and it moisturized well enough without irritation. Since this product is generally considered to be aimed at oily/combination skin and healing damage, I'm going to use it sparingly in the winter (as I normally switch to stronger lipid-based face creams this time of year) and try to save it for the hot humid weather. It's a great product for my skin type and comes from the maker of several longtime popular skincare products that AB users keep on their HG list.

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2024
content:
This water gel is great.

Nice ingredients, soothing, and super comfortable.

Provides nice hydration and great so far.

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2024
content:
This moisturizer has no appreciable scent. It's a lightweight, watery gel that feels both soothing and refreshing. It absorbs very quickly, is not sticky and definitely not greasy. I find that this hydrates my skin well. I think I would appreciate this more in the summer months.

If you find most moisturizers too heavy , if you have sensitive skin, or if you breakout easily, then this is for you. If your skin i very dry and needs intense moisture, then this alone may not be enough. Personally I like how this feels on my skin and will use it on those days when I just don't want anything heavy.

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2024
content:
I wasn't too sure about this gel when I opened the container, thought it might be mask like but it is not. It is a very soothing and lightweight moisturizer that goes on easily and is absorbed quickly.
I toned my skin and skipped serum so I could feel the effects of this gel. By lightweight, I mean it feels like it's almost not even there as it is absorbed so quickly. I think I was skimpy in my first application so I added a little more. I like how my face feels, cool and calm, a very natural feel and my skin tone looks great.
Product comes with a little scoop so you don't have to put your fingers in the jar.
Vitamin Tree is also known as Sea Buckthorn and is known to be high in Vitamin C.

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024
content: I had never heard of Vitamin Tree before, so I didn‚Äôt know what to expect from their Water Gel. The cream has a watery gel consistency, and once rubbed into my skin, it felt cool and a bit tacky but absorbed quickly. It left my skin feeling smooth, though not particularly hydrated. I appreciated that it had no scent. This product seems like it would work well for someone with acne-prone skin, but for my drier skin, I need something more moisturizing.

title: I'm from Vitamin Tree Water Gel, 75g, Korean moisturizer, Niacinamide, Panthenol, Vitamin C, hydrating, soothing

content:
After my 24-patch test with a good result, it was evident to me, I was going to like this water gel moisturizer. It feels more liquidy than cream moisturizers, maybe just a tad sticky, taking a moment to absorb, but after any apparent evidence of its material (the gel) presence, my face feels wonderful! Slightly cool, smooth and gently hydrated. Very, very pleasant!

I am a convinced fan in Korean Skin Care products. Not because it is a rage currently, but because of the results I'm receiving in using them. Not that all Korean skin care products are created equal. Some may definitely help more than others. And with that said, I really like this Vitamin Tree Water Gel! The ingredients are of the nature that have been proven to assist in keeping healthier facial skin and improving the appearance of it. I have done some reading on the research of these ingredients. The internet can provide that for anyone that cares to do it. And I for one, want to know what I am putting on my face. I tell my sister, "When there's a doubt, and evidence of impurities, then there's no doubt, about tossing it out!" So as silly as it may sound, that's my personal view.

The size is rather generous in comparison to many on the market. You get 2.64 oz./ 75g and with the results I'm reaping from using it, it's really worth the reasonable cost. I'm Tinkled Pink, I discovered this existed. Since, I recommended it to my sister, I can wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone else! üòä

title: I'm from Rice Glow Peel Off Mask 2.46 Ounce, Unmask Natural Glow, Rice Protein Complex
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2025
content: It took a bit of experimenting to figure out how to properly use this. Apply too thin of a layer, it becomes a flaky mess when it's time to peel it off the skin. Apply too thick of a layer, the mask takes forever to dry and my face ends up freezing cold in the meanwhile. I'd recommend patch testing it on the back of the hand to figure out how much product to apply. I think I got it now, but I have no idea how successful the peeling off part is going to be the next time I use this! It does leave my skin feels really soft and hydrated so it's worth the hassle in a way, but I am going to wait until it's much warmer to use up the rest of the product. The mask also has a sour scent to it, almost like vinegar or grade school glue, and the scent kind of lingers on the skin after the mask has been peeled off.

title: I'm from Rice Glow Peel Off Mask 2.46 Ounce, Unmask Natural Glow, Rice Protein Complex
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025
content: As I get older and work and play in the sun, my face is starting to appear older than I am so it is time to start caring for my skin finally and pamper it a little. This mask goes on very easily and dries completely clear. Once it has dried, the fun part begins. You peel it off from the side and roll your fingers over areas that didn't peel with the rest of it. It will leave your face super shiny! Here is where I use a roller to mash the remnants deep into my skin and then follow up with a soft, dry face cloth to remove any teeny bits that may have remained after removing it. It leaves my skin feeling soft and hydrated with a pretty shine. My face is very thankful for this rice mask.

title: I'm from Rice Glow Peel Off Mask 2.46 Ounce, Unmask Natural Glow, Rice Protein Complex

content: This was my first time using a rice mask but was excited to try. It's not a huge tube but I'll get a handful of masks out of it. The thick consistency was easy to smear all over without it running away or being messy. I didn't itch or sting while the mask set for 25 minutes and I loved that there were no irritating fragrances. That would have deducted major stars for me. The mask peeled of very easily and the sensation felt really good. I was left with skin that felt soft and very moisturized without looking shiny or oily. This is a product I will continue to enjoy using.

title: I'm from Rice Glow Peel Off Mask 2.46 Ounce, Unmask Natural Glow, Rice Protein Complex
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2025
content: This starts as a nice and soft cream that you spread over your face to shape the mask and it sticks quite well. It takes a minute to solidify a bit but once it does, you can move around and do what you need without worrying it'll drip or fall off like a clay mask or anything heavier so you can stay active and do what you need. You could also do nothing and relax which is what I'd recommend. Definitely do this in a decent layer and don't make it paper thin so it'll peel off easier. If you're wanting to save money by making it super thin, that's fine too. It'll dry faster and won't last as long and to remove it, just wash and rub your face rather than peeling it to make it easier
